About UsAE Strategies is Virginia based professional services firm, founded in 2003, providing human capital, data analytics, and management consulting to federal clients. We are a proven small business, with an established reputation and a track record of supporting critical initiatives across a wide range of federal clients. We offer a small business culture, where your contributions are valued, and where you operate within a friendly and collaborative work environment. We also provide competitive compensation and benefits, and the stability of a company with a 19-year track record of sustained success.OverviewThe Data Analyst will join an AE Strategies team supporting our federal client by analyzing workforce data and identifying workforce trends to produce data visualization dashboards and reports. The support will include working directly with stakeholders, clients, subject matter experts, and policy developers to analyze and predict key workforce metrics. The Data Analyst will support strategic workforce analysis and planning efforts such as creating efficiencies and standardization in how workforce data is aggregated and analyzed. Specific responsibilities include:Use both qualitative and quantitative techniques to evaluate and develop workforce measures and transform them into projective analytics.Conduct civilian workforce analysis and assessment of Human Capital (HC) programs.Establish standard analytics methodology for long term use and helps develop processes and tools.Work with the government client and data system owners to document data requirements, understand new data systems, and how they can be integrated together in a common data system.Establish and govern a roadmap to include strategic priorities and key milestones for the creation of combined data capabilities.Ensure compliance with established data related policies, standards, and roles and responsibilities.Qualifications: Master’s Degree and 2+ years of relevant experience or Bachelor’s Degree and 4+ years of relevant experience; HR data experience is a plusExperience with data analytics and visualization tools; experience with Databricks, Tableau, R, or Python is preferredExperience developing visualization tools, graphs, and PowerPoint presentationsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to pass a comprehensive federal background checkUS CitizenshipAE Strategies is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.Job Type: Full-timeSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Required)License/Certification:ability to obtain a Secret Security Clearance (Required)Work Location: Remote

At Fitbod, our mission is to empower our users of all ages, levels and experience in maximizing their health & wellbeing through a customized and dynamic fitness plan. We value ideas, set achievable goals and celebrate our wins - both big & small! It’s a challenging and evolving environment that enables you to learn and grow. As a part of a tightly-knit collaborative team, you will have the opportunity to work closely with our founders in the continued evolution of the Fitbod experience, and in doing so, directly help hundreds of thousands of loyal users practice fitness and lead healthier lives!
We are looking for a Data Analyst to help us monitor, understand, and improve key business metrics such as conversion and retention. You will be joining a fast-growing startup and a Data Science team with a proven record of turning health and activity data into concrete fitness guidance.
You will answer data-related questions from other teams. You will ask your own questions. You will help catch and document data errors. You will propose improvements in how we measure and use key company indicators. You will use a lot of SQL, Tableau, Big Query, Airflow, and Python.
You will back your recommendations with empirical evidence when data is available. You will learn and grow and help others learn and grow. You will feel challenged. You will feel a warm fuzzy feeling when you see our users share their stories of how they got fitter and healthier.
Responsibilities
Measure and monitor core business metrics such as active users, customer retention, subscriber acquisition costs, and customer lifetime value.
Identify North Star metrics for measuring the impact of product, marketing and business features/decisions, using data insights to propose next steps on the company roadmap.
Do deep data dives into workout histories in order to understand user behavior.
Influence other teams (Product, Engineering, Customer Success, Marketing, etc) through presentations of data-centric reports, communicating the current and projected state of the business.
Analyze results of A/B tests and communicate their conclusions to non-technical teams.
Building and maintaining dashboards that effectively communicate data insights.
Minimum Requirements:
Expertise & fluency with SQL.
Expertise & fluency with Python, specifically with Pandas and Numpy.
Basic understanding of cloud computing platforms (AWS, GCP), including the ability to ssh into a vm and develop remotely.
Solid understanding of statistical inference (e.g. hypothesis testing, regression), experimental design, and analysis.
Ability to communicate statistical methods and results to non-technical audiences.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience using Airflow.
Experience communicating the results of analyses with product and leadership teams to influence product strategy.
Experience in product analytics, marketing, and operations analytics.
A passion for fitness!
Try our app for free! https://www.fitbod.me/
Positions are remote-only, with the option to work from our SF office when it is safe to do so.
We are looking for full-time teammates! Positions include a full benefits package including: Full Medical, Vision, Dental, Life & Disability Insurance, flexible time-off, Slavic 401(k) with a 4% company match, company-wide days off for wellness & social lunches (via Zoom of course), a stipend for the gym/fitness, and all employees are able to expense up to $2000USD/year for continuing their development while employed with Fitbod!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or Fitbod Applicant and Worker Privacy Notice.
By submitting your information, you agree that you have read and agree to the terms in our Fitbod Applicant and Worker Privacy Notice

Summary: Data Trust, a dynamic political data organization focused on center-right leaning advocacy and support is currently seeking a Data Processing Analyst, who will be responsible for helping to create and manage the development and maintenance of the processes associated with our underlying databases.
**This is a technically skilled position. If you do not have working knowledge of some required languages or programs you need not apply. Applicants who do not meet the minimum qualifications will not be considered. **
Why work at Data Trust?

Do you love data? Have a passion for politics? Enjoy working with large data sets? If this sounds like you, then Data Trust is the right place for you!
Responsibilities:

Develop data flow/ ETL processes
Research and implement features to improve the efficiency and reliability of the data infrastructure
Develop and maintain processes that transform raw data into standardized usable formats for our company and clients
Assist coworkers in writing efficient queries
Auditing and maintaining up-to-date consumer data
Auditing processed data to ensure quality before it is sent to clients

Experience with SQL is required
Experience with SSIS, Python, SAP is preferred, but not required, and we are willing to teach the right candidate
Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot database related problems
You have strong organizational, time management and prioritization skills that can operate in a sometimes high-pressure fast-paced environment while not missing deadlines or losing attention to detail
Maximize use of downtime to broaden skill set and evaluate existing processes
You love being part of a team, but can also operate independently
An understanding and willingness to work outside of “9-5” as needed

Join our dynamic, progressive team of IT professionals in an environment where you can learn, grow, and create innovative technology solutions to help our business flourish. Become a part of our rich heritage that has grown from a small family business to a global organization with a presence in over 180 countries. At the heart of the Kellogg Company is technology — a key enabler of how we market, sell and manufacture our well-known and beloved brands to consumers around the globe.
The Business Intelligence Analyst is a critical role which will collaborate with the business to answer questions and promote efficiencies by using data and advanced analytic techniques.
Location: We’re all currently working in a virtual / remote environment. This role will continue to work in a virtual / remote environment and can reside in any of the States in the US where Kellogg does business. There may be travel to Battle Creek, MI, or Naperville, IL, up to 25% in the future when Kellogg offices do reopen.
HERE’S A TASTE OF WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
This role will support the Data Scientists across the North American business and leadership to better enable analytics and data across the organization by doing the following:
Data Analysis - Assisting with the development, and deployment of data-driven predictive models to solve business problems using the most appropriate techniques in machine learning, and statistical modeling. Managing the processing of business models using appropriate analytical software. Data manipulation, validation & cleansing. Diving into large, and complex real-world data to produce innovative analysis of historical patterns in customer behaviors and product performance. Report/tool maintenance.
Direct Business Partnering - Preparing and distributing operational reporting to the business. Partnering with business leads and teammates to provide effective analytics solutions.
Decision support - Providing Ad hoc data as requested by various areas of the business. Collaborating with IT Delivery and Sustainment counterparts to ensure that solutions are well-documented, strategically aligned and sustainable.
YOUR RECIPE FOR SUCCESS
Required:
High School Diploma or GED plus related experience
Experience in data analysis, and modeling
Experience in report building and ad-hoc analysis
Experience using internal and external data sources (E.g. SAP, Nielsen, IRI) to create analytical reports
Experience with analytical software and technology (such as SAS, SAS Viya, R/Python, RStudio , R Shiny, AWS Data & Analytics, etc.)
Experience with SQL, Hive, Presto, Hadoop, or other data querying languages.
Experience using data visualization tools (E.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Effectively collaborate with people within a project team
Ability to identify and effectively resolve issues
Excellent communication and motivation skills, and ability to interact appropriately with all levels of the organization
Demonstrated experience translating complex and technical subject matter
Ability to work in conditions, which include multiple and sometime conflicting priorities
Bonus Points:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, or a related field
Relevant Consumer Packaged Goods industry experience
Experience supporting large scale system implementations
Experience developing analytics solutions using “Big Data” tools and techniques
WHAT’S NEXT

New Hire Benefits Guide

At Fitbod, our mission is to empower our users of all ages, levels and experience in maximizing their health & wellbeing through a customized and dynamic fitness plan. We value ideas, set achievable goals and celebrate our wins - both big & small! It’s a challenging and evolving environment that enables you to learn and grow. As a part of a tightly-knit collaborative team, you will have the opportunity to work closely with our founders in the continued evolution of the Fitbod experience, and in doing so, directly help hundreds of thousands of loyal users practice fitness and lead healthier lives!
We are looking for a Data Analyst to help us monitor, understand, and improve key business metrics such as conversion and retention. You will be joining a fast-growing startup and a Data Science team with a proven record of turning health and activity data into concrete fitness guidance.
You will answer data-related questions from other teams. You will ask your own questions. You will help catch and document data errors. You will propose improvements in how we measure and use key company indicators. You will use a lot of SQL, Tableau, Big Query, Airflow, and Python.
You will back your recommendations with empirical evidence when data is available. You will learn and grow and help others learn and grow. You will feel challenged. You will feel a warm fuzzy feeling when you see our users share their stories of how they got fitter and healthier.
Responsibilities
Measure and monitor core business metrics such as active users, customer retention, subscriber acquisition costs, and customer lifetime value.
Identify North Star metrics for measuring the impact of product, marketing and business features/decisions, using data insights to propose next steps on the company roadmap.
Do deep data dives into workout histories in order to understand user behavior.
Influence other teams (Product, Engineering, Customer Success, Marketing, etc) through presentations of data-centric reports, communicating the current and projected state of the business.
Analyze results of A/B tests and communicate their conclusions to non-technical teams.
Building and maintaining dashboards that effectively communicate data insights.
Minimum Requirements:
Expertise & fluency with SQL.
Expertise & fluency with Python, specifically with Pandas and Numpy.
Basic understanding of cloud computing platforms (AWS, GCP), including the ability to ssh into a vm and develop remotely.
Solid understanding of statistical inference (e.g. hypothesis testing, regression), experimental design, and analysis.
Ability to communicate statistical methods and results to non-technical audiences.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience using Airflow.
Experience communicating the results of analyses with product and leadership teams to influence product strategy.
Experience in product analytics, marketing, and operations analytics.
A passion for fitness!
Try our app for free! https://www.fitbod.me/
Positions are remote-only, with the option to work from our SF office when it is safe to do so.
We are looking for full-time teammates! Positions include a full benefits package including: Full Medical, Vision, Dental, Life & Disability Insurance, flexible time-off, Slavic 401(k) with a 4% company match, company-wide days off for wellness & social lunches (via Zoom of course), a stipend for the gym/fitness, and all employees are able to expense up to $2000USD/year for continuing their development while employed with Fitbod!

Paramount Global (NASDAQ: PARA, PARAA) is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic studios, networks and streaming services, Paramount's portfolio of consumer brands includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, Paramount+, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. Paramount delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry's most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, the company provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions. Overview & Responsibilities Associate Business Analyst – Reporting & Strategic Analysis
Our Technology Integration Management Office is actively seeking an Associate Business Analyst to contribute in building the analytic/reporting capabilities of the Technology organization. You will be part of a team charged with enabling data-centric decision making via reporting processes, data visualizations, and strategic analyses. You will champion our self-service reporting strategy and play a key role in helping us automate and create scalable frameworks for our reporting and analytics. In This Role You Will:
Design, develop, and maintain Tableau dashboards and visualizations with the goal of tracking project progress and status, financial and operational performance, metrics, ad hoc analyses.
Collaborate with key business partners to craft and develop metrics that enable success and change within their departments
Collaborate with internal teams to develop and implement our reporting and analytics strategy across business-critical Portfolio Program Management solutions
Identify critical bottlenecks and own projects to revamp the process for streamlining and automation.
Identify critical trends and provide meaningful business insights to senior leadership.
Partner with the Business Intelligence team to manage and structure our data and databases.
Monitor and govern the data, ensuring data quality and accuracy.
Assist with training of business users on self-service tools that can be used to effectively acquire data. Basic Qualifications
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Systems or related IT field required or equivalent work experience.
0-2 years of professional experience in a data analytics role. Core focus in business intelligence and/or analytics as well as data driven approach to problem solving
Advanced skills/knowledge of Excel and working knowledge of Tableau Additional Qualifications
Analytical background operating with large data sets to identify trends and meaningful insights.
Knowledge of SQL and relational databases, having built dashboards and reports in Tableau or Looker
PMI Certified or Consulting background preferred

Business Overview
Bring your heart to CVS Health
Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.

We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day.

CVS Health is an affirmative action employer, and is an equal opportunity employer, as are the physician-owned businesses for which CVS Health provides management services. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, promotion, or any other personnel action based on race, ethnicity, color, national origin, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Company
Federal Reserve Bank of Boston
The Data & Analytics team at Federal Reserve Bank of Boston (FRBB) has an exciting opportunity for an entry level role of Associate Data Analyst to join our team to play a key role in delivering analytical solutions across business units in the Bank. You will work with our core Data & Analytics team to provide business intelligence, automation, and advanced analytics solutions to transform data into meaningful insights and help business units make data-driven decisions. This role will have broad exposure to a wide range of business units within the organization and involve interacting with diverse range of stakeholders with varying data needs.
Responsibilities will consist of:
Collaborating with, and supporting the work, of senior analytics staff.
Cleaning, wrangling, and structuring data for analysis.
Working with data from across the FRBB to unlock new insights.
Providing and explaining statistical analyses ranging from descriptive statistics to predictive analytics.
Data visualization and storytelling to help businesses understand their data.
Engaging with business units to define business problems and recommend analytical solutions.
Developing automatable, well documented, and repeatable processes to operationalize insights.
Knowledge and experience:
Requires a Bachelor’s degree in any of these fields: data science/analytics, economics, statistics, mathematics, or similar quantitative field.
Exhibits excellent communication skills including strong verbal and writing skills.
Ability to work independently and effectively in a remote team environment.
Applies judgment and critical thinking to solve problems.
Examines problems and processes with a creative lens.
Desire to quickly learn and use new tools, technologies, and methodologies.
Technical skills:
Proficient with either R or Python
Strong data visualization skills and experience with different visualization tools (such as Tableau, PowerBI, RShiny, Dash, Plotly)
Familiarity with statistical modeling and data analysis techniques
Experience with SQL and strong understanding of database concepts
Adept with Excel
Nice to have but will learn in the role:
Experience using git and related repository manager(s)
Experience in Linux environments
Experience with agile software development workflow tools
Experience with cloud-based data and analytics related services
Understanding of end-to-end analytics processes in a non-academi c setting with ability to gather data and translate business requirements to provide appropriate analytical solutions to solve business problems, ranging from basic reporting to predictive analytics.
What to expect in your
First Month
You will complete a holistic training to get familiar with the internal development tools and analytics processes.
You will have a dedicated mentor with whom you will work on a daily basis.
You will meet with stakeholders from the business units and get assigned to one or more ongoing projects.
First Six Months
You will develop strong relationships with the portfolio business units.
You will present your work to business unit partners, leadership, and/or stakeholders from the Federal Reserve System.
You will suggest new tools or processes that will enhance team productivity.
First Year
You will have your own portfolio of analytics projects.
You will be a key driver for the improvement of existing internal processes.
You will explore new relationships with partners from FRBB and across the Federal Reserve System
All employees assigned to this position will be subject to FBI fingerprint/ criminal background and Patriot Act/ Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) watch list checks at least once every five years.
Due to the access to sensitive material, this role carries a risk rating that requires additional background-screening criteria be met. This may not be complete until after you begin working at the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston. The risk rating for this position has been determined as “MODERATE” and the enhanced screening consists of the following:
verification of prior employment (via inquiry);
verification of education (via inquiry);
verification of residence (via inquiry);
verification of US citizenship or status as lawful Permanent Resident Alien with at least three or more years of US residency from the date of legal entry to the US;

such other screening criteria that may be required by your role.

Hence, we would provide you with two notifications: the first, after your initial pre-employment screening is complete; the second, after you have passed this additional risk-based screening.
In addition to any document(s) you would provide to support your work authorization on the I-9 Form, you must provide appropriate document(s) to verify your status as a US Citizen or as a lawful Permanent Resident Alien with at least three or more years of US residency from the date of legal entry to US. These documents may include:
a birth certificate issued by a State, municipality, or territory of the US;
an original I-551 document Permanent Resident Alien card, which you must provide if you are a legal Permanent Resident Alien;
an original Naturalization Certificate;
a US Passport (for those foreign born employees claiming US Citizenship); or
a Report of Birth Abroad (children of US Citizens born abroad).

Company Description
At Biogen, we offer a workplace that is unique, connected, resilient and impactful. Our purpose to find cures for rare diseases is a unique focus within our industry. We are connected as a team by this shared purpose, the pride we have in our work, and the inspiration we obtain from the lives we’re changing. We are resilient as we overcome obstacles, following the science to deliver for our patients. Most of all, our work allows us to have an impact. An impact on our patients’ lives and on changing the course of medicine.

Job Description
As the Imaging Data Analyst, you manage transfers and processing of medical image data files from Biogen-contracted external vendors and partners. The imaging transfers are collected in support of research projects and clinical development. You ensure alignment of the received data files with the expected inventory from the study performed, leveraging a secure transfer for receipt. As the Imaging Data Analyst, you will code processing scripts to assess the data quality (QC) summarize and organize the data to enable data use for analysis. You will collaborate with scientists to enable analytics, including participating in the sharing of Biogen imaging data with internal and external analytics stakeholders.
What You’ll Do
Produce coded scripts for automated QC and processing of medium to large medical image datasets. These scripts not only assess the quality and completeness of received imaging data, but also can reorganize the hierarchical structure of the data, and extract and package image data to align with internal and external image data sharing requests.
Participate in image data transfer specification review in coordination with imaging operations team and image data supplier.
Coordinate with imaging operations team, imaging scientists and external organizations to resolve quality issues and missing data discovered in image transfers. Works with team members to ensure uniformity in deliverables, across all types of imaging data.
Liaise with external individuals to troubleshoot access to Biogen’s secure transfer platform.
Who You Are
You are an Imaging Data analyst who has strong experience with image data types and image files and who uses your effective written and oral communication skills to collaborate with scientists and external analytics vendors.

Qualifications
Required Skills
Bachelor’s degree with 5 year’s work experience; Master’s degree with 2 year’s work experience (preferred), in Biomedical and Biomedical Engineering or other related scientific fields.
Experience with image data types including dicom, nifti, minc
Direct experience in working with image files
2-3 years’ experience with imaging data tools that may include dicom toolkit dcmtk, pydicom, minc toolkit Ideal toolkit (ITK), Matlab or Osirix
Experience reviewing and organizing imaging data in a Linux environment using computer scripting that may include shell scripting, Python or R.
2-5 years’ experience coding, including shell scripting, Python, R or similar languages.
Preferred Skills
Understanding of clinical trial data handling, extending to imaging data, in a regulated environment (Good Clinical Practice (GCP)).
Exposure to large dataset processing tools to analyze multi-terabyte datasets.
Understanding of deidentification techniques and their application within medical imaging.
Additional Information
Why Biogen?
Our mission to find therapies for neurological and rare diseases is a unique focus within our industry and this shared purpose is what connects us as a team. We work together to overcome obstacles and to follow the science. We are resilient as we strive to make an impact on our patients’ lives and on changing the course of medicine. Together, we pioneer. Together, we thrive.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Product Management
Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with over 220 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. As our slate of original productions and licensed content increases, we must scale and formalize management of studio data to meet the changing needs of the business. Now is an exciting time to join a talented, energetic team that is helping to shape operational data standards and practices for a growing studio.

We are looking for a Data Quality Analyst to join the Studio Data Management team within Studio Product Innovation (SPI). SPI creates applications that drive innovation in content creation. Our team manages several large operational data sets that are used broadly across these applications. We work closely with product teams to ensure that the data is bringing value to their products while also working to improve underlying data quality through better processes, tools, guidelines and user education.

In this role, you will focus on the Person ID dataset for Cast and Crew (collectively, “Talent”), which is foundational to the application ecosystem. Maintaining properly structured and connected Person IDs is critical to driving a variety of functions for studio teams in Content, Production, Business and Legal, and beyond. Through a combination of project work and ongoing monitoring, you will shepherd continuous improvements to the talent dataset across a wide variety of domains. Additionally, you will provide Person ID-related support to users across the studio. Key partners outside our team include product managers, engineers, designers, application users, as well as training and customer support teams. A successful candidate will love digging into large data sets to find patterns and diagnose problems, have the agility to pivot between heads-down project execution and user-focused problem-solving, and be excited by the opportunity to be part of an evolving team.
Responsibilities
Audit and investigate data activity and integrity, preparing summaries of findings for both technical and non-technical audiences
Execute data projects to improve quality metrics involving the Person ID and key entity relationships
Partner with Data, Product Management, and Engineering colleagues on configuration, execution, and monitoring of data ingests and new integrations
Provide Person ID support to users across the studio, handling basic issues while also investigating, diagnosing and resolving more complex issues
Educate users on best data practices in order to improve data quality
Create more efficient ways to analyze and work with large data sets
Create and maintain data documentation
Qualifications
2+ years experience in data/metadata/content management or operations
2+ years experience in a physical production or post-production environment, studio, production company, Below-The-Line agency, or motion picture industry organization
Proficiency with Google Suite, table-based applications (e.g. Excel, Airtable), and content management systems
Strong analytical skills and an ability to synthesize information across a broad ecosystem to diagnose problems and devise solutions
Strong understanding of workflow and ability to recognize inefficiencies
Knowledge of data lifecycle and data governance concepts
Strong ability to communicate to different audiences
Flexible in an evolving environment
Excellent time-management skills
Experience with industry data tools (Studio System, IMDB, Variety Insight)
Deeply knowledgeable of above the line and below the line talent, agencies, production companies, vendors and studios
Nice to haves:
Experience with Java script and SQL queries
Experience working with product and/or engineering teams
If your experience doesn’t check off every box in our list of qualifications, but you think you’d be a great addition to our team anyway, we want to hear from you! Please attach a cover letter to your resume explaining how your skills and experience could enhance this role.
Netflix Culture
Netflix's culture is an integral part of what makes us successful, and we approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that bringing together different perspectives and backgrounds helps build stronger teams. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Data Analyst, Strategy & Analytics


About You

You are an effective communicator, especially adept at conveying complex data in a clear and simple manner. About Us
We are a highly diverse, collaborative, and entrepreneurial team of innovators, on a mission to transform the way ISPs serve consumers today. 2022 will be a pivotal year for our company, as we transform our service approach, lead the way in fiber technology innovations, and launch an enviable brand and customer experience.

You perform quantitative and qualitative analysis with structured and unstructured data sets to identify opportunities and weaknesses in the business. You are responsible for directly sourcing data using computer languages and analyzing in a way that supports practical decision making and strategy setting. You will communicate your findings and recommend strategy to executives and business partners.
Responsibilities
Provide analytical support to optimize subscriber counts, operational processes and costs, and revenue.
Drive and support key customer experience and retention initiatives using quantitative and qualitative data and analytics.
Manipulate large data sets, navigating a variety of servers, data types and data structures.
Drive end to end analytical process, from formulation of requirements, data acquisition, analysis, validation, and summarization of relevant results.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required
Aptitude for analytical thinking and data-based decision making

Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills

THE ORGANIZATION

The Charter School Growth Fund (CSGF) is a leading nonprofit venture philanthropy fund dedicated to identifying the nation's best public charter schools, investing in their expansion, and helping to increase their impact. Our "portfolio" includes 140+ charter school networks that operate 1,100+ schools and serve more than 500,000 students. We are committed to expanding the impact of schools that are closing achievement and opportunity gaps. CSGF operates with the same strategies, discipline, and focus as a venture capital firm by awarding multi-year grants and loans to talented education entrepreneurs building networks of high-quality charter schools that enroll traditionally underserved students. Ultimately, we think the portfolio can grow to serve ~1,000,000 students within a decade.

This is an exciting time to join the Charter School Growth Fund. We are launching our next philanthropic fund in 2022, building on our 15-year track record of success. CSGF's new five-year "Fund IV" will be larger in size and scope than previous funds, with a goal to continue to fuel charter sector growth, accelerate innovation, and strengthen long-term outcomes for students, particularly students of color and those from low-income backgrounds. Our new fund will continue to prioritize investments in leaders of color as our current portfolio is led by more than 50% leaders of color and more than 50% female leaders. We believe it is vital for the networks we support to be proximate to the lived experiences of the students and communities they serve.

THE OPPORTUNITY

About Our Team

With the launch of the next philanthropic fund, the Analytics team is expanding and evolving to meet the growing needs of an ever increasingly data driven organization. The Analytics team sits at the intersection of our investment, impact, innovation, policy, finance, and talent teams which all have data needs to drive their goals. The Analytics team also serves the need to progress monitor CSGF's key performance indicators that measure our impact across the network. These insights are shared internally as well as with our many funders. In addition, we seek to expand the role of analytics to provide direct analysis support to our growing portfolio of charter school networks. To accomplish this, we leverage nationally collected data sets from a variety of sources and provide flexible and timely analysis to our many stakeholders and partners.

The team is made up of three core functions: engineering, data products, and insights research. The full-time permanent role will develop data products, particularly dashboards, for technical and non-technical audiences. This role reports to the Director of Data Products.

Our Analytics Stack

Google Cloud (backbone architecture)
Airflow (data ingestion and orchestration)
BigQuery (data warehouse)
dbt Cloud (data modeling/monitoring)
Tableau (data visualization)

About This Role

As a Data Analyst you will deliver on customer-centered data and analytical products that enhance efficiency, support data-driven decision-making, and enable our organization to scale. Specifically, you will support the growth and maintenance of our current dashboard portfolio in Tableau. In addition, you will have direct involvement in the reporting and analysis of key performance indicators, including student outcomes and school performance metrics.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Below is a general outline of responsibilities. CSGF is a fast-moving organization, roles and responsibilities may change to meet the needs of the organization and the charter networks we support.

It is not expected that every candidate will meet all of the desired qualifications; above all else, we are seeking candidates with an eagerness and ability to learn new skills and solve interesting problems in an environment that encourages creative thinking, quick feedback loops, and opportunities for professional development.

Data Visualization

Build and maintain interactive Tableau dashboards and infographics that enable actionable insights, tailoring visualizations to meet the needs of users while adhering to brand standards
Execute a variety of techniques in Tableau, including forming relationships between multiple data sources, creating field calculations and dashboard actions, and designing more advanced charts (e.g., hex-tile maps, lollipop charts, donut charts, etc.
Synthesize qualitative data, communicating key themes and messages through visualizations
Develop dashboard mock-ups to help elicit and define requirements of data requests
Actively searches for opportunities to experiment with different design approaches and formats, contributing to the team's ongoing efforts to innovate and improve its product line

Data Collection & Validation

Participate in smaller-scale collection cycles throughout the year, including designing surveys, compiling survey results, and reporting outcomes
Perform quality audits of collected data and providing assistance to resolve issues
Support the development and execution of data workflows that ingest, validate, test and model data for analytics needs

Data Modeling and Reporting

Partner with the Analytics Engineer to develop a metrics layer in SQL to centralize organizational key performance measures
Support the Analytics Engineer in transforming datasets for end products, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions
Query from the data warehouse in SQL, calculating and aggregating data when necessary, to respond to data requests.
Support due diligence on high-performing charter school operators by conducting analysis and developing products to display achievement and enrollment data

You're a good fit if you are:

A design-savvy analyst or data-savvy designer with high interest in designing data visualizations and telling impactful stories
Excited about leveraging the wealth of education data we currently collect to influence decision making and increase our impact
Interest or passion in education and commitment to CSGF's mission

You care about questions like:

What is the most essential information to present and visualize in a dashboard?
How can I strategically implement visual design elements (e.g., color, contrast, alignment, white space etc.)?
What would it take for us to always collect valid and clean data for analysis?
How can I ensure that my SQL query returns the correct output to answer the question that Team ABC asked?
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Expected Skills and Characteristics

Exceptional quantitative skills with demonstrated ability to create data visualizations
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of spreadsheets (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets), including lookup functions and pivot tables.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills and storytelling ability
Strong attention to detail and focus on accuracy over urgency
Capacity to quickly learn new skills, seek honest feedback from peers and mentors, and know when to ask for help

Nice to Haves But Not Necessary

Experience with data visualization tools (ex: Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc)
Experience with visual design tools (ex: Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, etc.)
Experience with SQL, specifically in BigQuery

Professional Experience

At least one year of full-time professional experience in data analytics, education, and/or similar fields
WORKING AT CSGF

We are focused on hiring and developing great people and believe that building diverse perspectives across our team makes us more effective in expanding our impact. (This is reflected in Our Commitment to Diversity Statement.) Our core values are:

We work relentlessly to create efficient, measurable, and sustainable results. We strive for excellence and pursue our mission tenaciously. Ideally, you thrive working in a self-directed manner in a fluid environment where flexibility and tenacity are required.
We embrace calculated risks and new approaches. We have an entrepreneurial spirit that welcomes innovation, diversity of ideas, and risk. We rely on you to question conventional wisdom and think independently.
We are truthful, fair, and trustworthy in all aspects of our work. We hold ourselves and our partners to the highest ethical standards. We trust you will too.
We appreciate the challenges faced by education entrepreneurs and recognize the limits of our own knowledge. We understand that our ultimate success depends on that of our partners. Your humility will be key to building trusted and authentic relationships.
We value each of our team members as individuals but believe that we achieve the best results by working together. We willingly sacrifice individual interests and recognition for greater collective impact. We hope having fun at work is important to you and that you are a team player.
COMPENSATION

Compensation is commensurate with experience and education. The target salary range for this role is $65,000 - $85,000 annually. CSGF offers a very competitive compensation package.

START DATE

CSGF is seeking candidates who can start as soon as possible.

COVID-19 VACCINATION POLICY

Unless prohibited by state or local law, CSGF requires that all staff be fully vaccinated with an FDA or WHO authorized vaccine (or approved for an exemption as a reasonable accommodation due to a medical reason or sincerely held religious belief). CSGF abides by each state's requirements and acknowledges those may change over time. If moved forward to the phone screen stage, you have the chance to ask the talent team any questions you may have about this requirement.

Charter School Growth Fund provides equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees.

Job Description

The Chief Data & Analytics Office (CDAO) operates to provide analytics, data and business intelligence support to businesses across the company. This role supports GM's Digital Business Team (DBT), specifically around the recently launched OnStar Guardian app, focused on growing the OnStar business by bringing key OnStar safety features outside the vehicle and into communities.

Roles and Responsibilities

You will be responsible for OKR and KPI measurement, presenting updates to the Safety and Security LOB business partners
You will quantify the impacts of new initiatives, root causing changes in performance, and perform frequent ad hoc analyses
You will help create work related to strategy, roadmap, critical metric definition, reporting and dashboards.
You will be responsible for analyzing database tables and writing queries to create consumption data assets. Additionally, you will be responsible for working with IT and business partners to identify data feeds and data points that need to be created.
You will support analytical projects from conception to completion with high velocity and quality, be cognizant of status, roadblocks and pace of project throughout and escalate as necessary to ensure success and on-time delivery to business partners.

You are naturally curious and are energized understanding the why behind the what

Ability to quickly ramp up on new domains and understand business needs
Strong business domain knowledge - customer experience, contact center performance, business analytics, sales/marketing analytics
Expertise in creating consumption data assets and deploying reports using BI tools such as PowerBI or Cognos
Expertise in programming languages such as SQL, Python or R
Bachelors' Degree or equivalent work experience

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Benefits Overview

The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:
Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statements

The policy of General Motors is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression or veteran status. Additionally, General Motors is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including individuals with disabilities. The RMS CDAO Data Science Analyst will be a hands-on practitioner tasked with conducting experiments, building solutions, and partnering with stakeholders and analysts to identify new opportunities utilizing the large sets of structured and unstructured data. They will leverage their knowledge and experience to deliver insights into business problems. The selected candidate will be a practicing data scientist.

The work location is the Aguadilla, Puerto Rico facility; full-time telecommuters will be considered for this position but must reside in Puerto Rico.

Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Apply and/or develop advanced technologies, scientific principles, theories, and concepts to identify meaningful patterns in data in sometimes ambiguous problem spacesResponsible for modeling complex business problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities using statistical, algorithmic, mining, and visualization techniquesCollaborate with business stakeholders to identify business opportunities and requirements to develop associated analytical models that deliver useful, actionable insights, or recommendations

Understanding of model interpretation and explainability
Experience with storytelling and visualizations within the realm of data analytics
Experience working with virtual teamsExperience with Python or similar, Pandas, sklearn, tensorflow, pytorch, Domino or AWS/Docker, Jupyter Notebooks

Associate Compliance Analyst- Risk and Brand Protection

Help Desk Associate Analyst - Risk & Brand Protection / Ethics & Compliance


This position will support operational processes of the Deloitte U.S. Firms' Risk & Brand Protection. Key responsibilities of this position are to safeguard Deloitte and client confidential information, assist transfer of personal data from Deloitte laptops, and provide customer support to Deloitte US Entities' partners/principals and employees interacting with the Compliance HelpDesk.

Location - any U.S. Deloitte office

Work you'll do


As a HelpDesk Associate Analyst, you'll use your analytical, research and investigative skills to:

Data Protection Activities:

Review requests to remove personal data from Deloitte laptop
Provide guidance and process direction
Ensure identified data is centralized and free from Deloitte and client confidential information (e.g., intellectual property, firm deliverables, and creations of work)
Schedule one-on-one appointments, review and resolve challenges, and oversee successful transfer of personal data to a personal device
Recognize and resolve common error messages associated with Deloitte technical controls
Collaborate with other teams: Collaborate with other internal stakeholders (e.g., Talent, Confidential Information (CI) Champions, Information Technology Services (ITS), Confidential and Privacy, Culture Risk and Insider Threat) as needed
Track support activities methodically with relentless attention to quality, accuracy and timeliness. Track progress, average time to complete, and lessons learned. Support the preparation of periodic reports for reporting and analytics
Assist in various projects such as making updates to procedure documents (e.g., data removal forms, templates, tools) to improve the personal data removal process

Key skills required:

Excellent verbal and written business communication skills
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to apply technical skills related to adjusting software settings and general questions related to data removal
Attention to quality and detail a must
Ability to work well under pressure: responsiveness, accuracy and sense of urgency are essential to this role
Ability to apply critical thinking in evaluating different scenarios
Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with appropriate discretion
Ability to prioritize work and work independently; know when to seek guidance
Proficiency in MS Office - Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Previous experience of working in ServiceNow, SharePoint, and MS OneDrive
Limited sponsorship may be available

The team

Ethics and Compliance

The objective of the Ethics and Compliance team is to support Deloitte's shared values and Global Principles of Business Conduct by centrally coordinating and enhancing existing ethics and compliance practices. The program and underlying policies and procedures have been designed to prevent, detect, and address ethics and compliance issues.

Qualifications include

Bachelor's Degree

Working knowledge and recognition of common financial documents/statements

Work Experience

At least 1-2 years of relevant experience (e.g., customer support, comfortable working with technology, customer-facing) as an analyst

How you'll grow


At Deloitte, we've invested a great deal to create a rich environment in which our professionals can grow. We want all our people to develop in their own way, playing to their own strengths as they hone their leadership skills. And, as a part of our efforts, we provide our professionals with a variety of learning and networking opportunities-including exposure to leaders, sponsors, coaches, and challenging assignments-to help accelerate their careers along the way. No two people learn in exactly the same way. So, we provide a range of resources including live classrooms, team-based learning, and eLearning. DU: The Leadership Center in India, our state-of-the-art, world-class learning Center in the Hyderabad offices is an extension of the Deloitte University (DU) in Westlake, Texas, and represents a tangible symbol of our commitment to our people's growth and development.

University Overview

The University of Pennsylvania, the largest private employer in Philadelphia, is a world-renowned leader in education, research, and innovation. This historic, Ivy League school consistently ranks among the top 10 universities in the annual U.S. News & World Report survey. Penn has 12 highly-regarded schools that provide opportunities for undergraduate, graduate and continuing education, all influenced by Penn's distinctive interdisciplinary approach to scholarship and learning. As an employer Penn has been ranked nationally on many occasions with the most recent award from Forbes who named Penn one of America's Best Employers By State in 2021.

Penn offers a unique working environment within the city of Philadelphia. The University is situated on a beautiful urban campus, with easy access to a range of educational, cultural, and recreational activities. With its historical significance and landmarks, lively cultural offerings, and wide variety of atmospheres, Philadelphia is the perfect place to call home for work and play.

The University offers a competitive benefits package that includes excellent healthcare and tuition benefits for employees and their families, generous retirement benefits, a wide variety of professional development opportunities, supportive work and family benefits, a wealth of health and wellness programs and resources, and much more.

COVID-19 vaccination is a requirement for all positions at the University of Pennsylvania. New hires are expected to be fully vaccinated before beginning work at the University. For more information about Penn's vaccine requirements and the use of Penn Open Pass, visit the Penn COVID-19 Response website for the latest information.

Posted Job Title
Data Analyst Junior (Neuropsychiatry)

Job Profile Title
Programmer Junior

Job Description Summary
Data Analyst Junior

As part of the Department of Psychiatry, the Neurodevelopment & Psychosis Section, the Lifespan Brain Institute (LiBI) and the Brain Behavior Laboratory (BBL) are devoted to the study of brain and behavior throughout the lifespan. We use: 1) innovative neuroimaging techniques, and 2) the application of cutting-edge psychometric and bioinformatics resources. The Data Analyst Junior will provide support for managing and analyzing data within the lab of Drs. Ruben and Raquel Gur.

Job Description

The Perelman School of Medicine at the University of Pennsylvania is the oldest and one of the finest medical schools in the United States. Penn is rich in tradition and heritage and at the same time consistently at the forefront of new developments and innovations in medical education and research. Since its founding in 1765 the School has been a strong presence in the community and prides itself on educating the leaders of tomorrow in patient care, biomedical research, and medical education. http://www.med.upenn.edu/ .

Data Analyst Junior

We are seeking a full-time Data Analyst Junior to join our team immediately. This position offers a highly interdisciplinary research experience, combining approaches from cognitive neuroscience, experimental psychology, psychiatry, and statistics with neuroimaging. The applicant will have the opportunity to participate in major methodological and analytic developments, publications, and presentations.

Responsibilities will include supporting principal investigators, fellows, and technical staff with in-depth analyses using multiple complex datasets. While the position is entry-level (i.e. recent college graduates are encouraged to apply!), the analyst will work closely with a PhD-level statistician/psychometrician to climb very steep learning curves quickly. The analyst will thereby acquire an unusually advanced skillset compared to most entry-level positions. For this reason, we are especially seeking applicants with long-term career goals in statistics or psychometrics.

Example tasks might include being asked to:
1. Determine the statistical effects of missing data and compare the results of some available imputation methods (maximum likelihood, random forest, etc.).

2. Determine the number of latent dimensions underlying a data set and apply factor analysis and item response theory to estimate model parameters for such uses as computerized adaptive testing and analysis of item bias.

3. Demonstrate (visually) a statistical effect in several different ways (e.g. using panels versus color-coding).

4. Link a list of physical street addresses to geocodes and link those geocodes to census data from multiple years.

5. Simulate item responses with other variables to determine how many Likert response categories are likely to be necessary on a personality scale with a specific number of items.

The applicant is not expected to be familiar with the above-s/he will be taught-but it is important that at least some of the above procedures seem interesting to the applicant.

Other duties might include: performing data management functions like extracting, importing, and exporting data from various in-house applications; restructuring and/or merging datasets; assisting with user documentation; running queries on datasets using SQL; preparing datasets for analyses; resolving data inconsistencies; and taking responsibility for completeness and quality of multiple data sets.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Physics, Statistics, Neuroscience or Experimental Psychology and 0-1 year of experience or equivalent combination of education and experience required. A Bachelor's or Master's degree and 1-2 years of research preferred. Applicants with a relevant major (psychology, statistics, economics, computer science, biology, or neuroscience) will be given preference, and applicants with relevant long-term career goals (e.g. professor of statistics, entrepreneur in the machine learning industry, etc.) are especially preferred.

Preferred Skills:
R, Python, SPSS syntax, Stata, or another script-based statistical package. Job will involve mostly R.

Background check required. Position contingent on funding.

Working Conditions
Office, Library, Computer Room; Requires extensive safety

Physical Effort
Typically sitting at a desk or table; Occasional lifting 25 lb. or less

Job Location - City, State
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Department / School
Perelman School of Medicine

Pay Range
$20.00 - $30.67

Affirmative Action Statement
Penn adheres to a policy that prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, citizenship status, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected class.

Special Requirements
Background check required after a conditional job offer is made. Consideration of the background check will be tailored to the requirements of the job.

University Benefits

Health, Life, and Flexible Spending Accounts : Penn offers comprehensive medical, prescription, behavioral health, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits to protect you and your family's health and welfare. You can also use flexible spending accounts to pay for eligible health care and dependent care expenses with pre-tax dollars.

Tuition : Take advantage of Penn's exceptional tuition benefits. You, your spouse, and your dependent children can get tuition assistance here at Penn. Your dependent children are also eligible for tuition assistance at other institutions.

Retirement: Penn offers generous retirement plans to help you save for your future. Penn's Basic, Matching, and Supplemental retirement plans allow you to save for retirement on a pre-tax or Roth basis. Choose from a wide variety of investment options through TIAA and Vanguard.

Time Away from Work: Penn provides you with a substantial amount of time away from work during the course of the year. This allows you to relax, take vacations, attend to personal affairs, recover from illness or injury, spend time with family-whatever your personal needs may be.

Long-Term Care Insurance: In partnership with Genworth Financial, Penn offers faculty and staff (and your eligible family members) long-term care insurance to help you cover some of the costs of long-term care services received at home, in the community or in a nursing facility. If you apply when you're newly hired, you won't have to provide proof of good health or be subject to underwriting requirements. Eligible family members must always provide proof of good health and are subject to underwriting.

Wellness and Work-life Resources : Penn is committed to supporting our faculty and staff as they balance the competing demands of work and personal life. That's why we offer a wide variety of programs and resources to help you care for your health, your family, and your work-life balance.

Professional and Personal Development: Penn provides an array of resources to help you advance yourself personally and professionally.

University Resources: As a member of the Penn community, you have access to a wide range of University resources as well as cultural and recreational activities. Take advantage of the University's libraries and athletic facilities, or visit our arboretum and art galleries. There's always something going on at Penn, whether it's a new exhibit at the Penn Museum, the latest music or theater presentation at the Annenberg Center, or the Penn Relays at Franklin Field to name just a few examples. As a member of the Penn community, you're right in the middle of the excitement-and you and your family can enjoy many of these activities for free.

Discounts and Special Services : From arts and entertainment to transportation and mortgages, you'll find great deals for University faculty and staff. Not only do Penn arts and cultural centers and museums offer free and discounted admission and memberships to faculty and staff. You can also enjoy substantial savings on other goods and services such as new cars from Ford and General Motors, cellular phone service plans, movie tickets, and admission to theme parks.

Flexible Work Hours: Flexible work options offer creative approaches for completing work while promoting balance between work and personal commitments. These approaches involve use of non-traditional work hours, locations, and/or job structures.

Penn Home Ownership Services: Penn offers a forgivable loan for eligible employees interested in buying a home or currently residing in West Philadelphia, which can be used for closing costs or home improvements.

Adoption Assistance: Penn will reimburse eligible employees on qualified expenses in connection with the legal adoption of an eligible child, such as travel or court fees, for up to two adoptions in your household.

To learn more, please visit: https://www.hr.upenn.edu/PennHR/benefits-pay

Company Description
At Biogen, we offer a workplace that is unique, connected, resilient and impactful. Our purpose to find cures for rare diseases is a unique focus within our industry. We are connected as a team by this shared purpose, the pride we have in our work, and the inspiration we obtain from the lives we’re changing. We are resilient as we overcome obstacles, following the science to deliver for our patients. Most of all, our work allows us to have an impact. An impact on our patients’ lives and on changing the course of medicine.

Job Description
As the Imaging Data Analyst, you manage transfers and processing of medical image data files from Biogen-contracted external vendors and partners. The imaging transfers are collected in support of research projects and clinical development. You ensure alignment of the received data files with the expected inventory from the study performed, leveraging a secure transfer for receipt. As the Imaging Data Analyst, you will code processing scripts to assess the data quality (QC) summarize and organize the data to enable data use for analysis. You will collaborate with scientists to enable analytics, including participating in the sharing of Biogen imaging data with internal and external analytics stakeholders.
What You’ll Do
Produce coded scripts for automated QC and processing of medium to large medical image datasets. These scripts not only assess the quality and completeness of received imaging data, but also can reorganize the hierarchical structure of the data, and extract and package image data to align with internal and external image data sharing requests.
Participate in image data transfer specification review in coordination with imaging operations team and image data supplier.
Coordinate with imaging operations team, imaging scientists and external organizations to resolve quality issues and missing data discovered in image transfers. Works with team members to ensure uniformity in deliverables, across all types of imaging data.
Liaise with external individuals to troubleshoot access to Biogen’s secure transfer platform.
Who You Are
You are an Imaging Data analyst who has strong experience with image data types and image files and who uses your effective written and oral communication skills to collaborate with scientists and external analytics vendors.

Qualifications
Required Skills
Bachelor’s degree with 5 year’s work experience; Master’s degree with 2 year’s work experience (preferred), in Biomedical and Biomedical Engineering or other related scientific fields.
Experience with image data types including dicom, nifti, minc
Direct experience in working with image files
2-3 years’ experience with imaging data tools that may include dicom toolkit dcmtk, pydicom, minc toolkit Ideal toolkit (ITK), Matlab or Osirix
Experience reviewing and organizing imaging data in a Linux environment using computer scripting that may include shell scripting, Python or R.
2-5 years’ experience coding, including shell scripting, Python, R or similar languages.
Preferred Skills
Understanding of clinical trial data handling, extending to imaging data, in a regulated environment (Good Clinical Practice (GCP)).
Exposure to large dataset processing tools to analyze multi-terabyte datasets.
Understanding of deidentification techniques and their application within medical imaging.
Additional Information
Why Biogen?
Our mission to find therapies for neurological and rare diseases is a unique focus within our industry and this shared purpose is what connects us as a team. We work together to overcome obstacles and to follow the science. We are resilient as we strive to make an impact on our patients’ lives and on changing the course of medicine. Together, we pioneer. Together, we thrive.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Company Description
At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible.
At our core, Western Digital is a company of problem solvers. People achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. For decades, we’ve been doing just that. Our technology helped people put a man on the moon.
We are a key partner to some of the largest and highest growth organizations in the world. From energizing the most competitive gaming platforms, to enabling systems to make cities safer and cars smarter and more connected, to powering the data centers behind many of the world’s biggest companies and public cloud, Western Digital is fueling a brighter, smarter future.
Binge-watch any shows, use social media or shop online lately? You’ll find Western Digital supporting the storage infrastructure behind many of these platforms. And, that flash memory card that captures and preserves your most precious moments? That’s us, too.
We offer an expansive portfolio of technologies, storage devices and platforms for business and consumers alike. Our data-centric solutions are comprised of the Western Digital®, G-Technology™, SanDisk® and WD® brands.
Today’s exceptional challenges require your unique skills. It’s You & Western Digital. Together, we’re the next BIG thing in data.

Data visualization through dashboards with tools such as Tableau, Excel and others
Acquire data from multiple data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Develop new reports per user requirement
Maintain and update existing reports based on routine schedules
Create and maintain various databases, data mining tools, and Excel macros

Qualifications

Computer Science or related technical degree with at least 3yr experience
Python (or equivalent) scripting to automate the workflow to auto generate report
Advanced skills in Excel including Excel macros, pivot and charting
Experience with Oracle Service Cloud or Tableau will be a plus

Summary
The MIL Corporation seeks a Business Analyst to support a Federal Government client at our Charleston, South Carolina location. As a member of the team, the successful candidate will provide business analysis and support services to include the following:

Responsibilities
Understand customers’ business processes and practices in specifically assigned areas.
Support project initiatives utilizing project management methodology
Research and analyze legal/regulatory requirements directed by OMB, Treasury, GSA, etc.
Working with the Project Lead, document the "as-is" process to determine if a process can be streamlined, consider improvement options, including automation, and present to management.
Update or create, as appropriate, documentation to support the Global Financial Operations directorate (GFO).
May be involved with identifying training requirements, conducting training, and reviewing/preparing documentation.
Utilize excellent communication skills when working with GFO staff, bureaus, agencies and posts.
Comply with ISO-9001 requirements and support objectives.

Required Qualifications

BA/BS in financial management, business administration or a combination of courses and related work experience and at least 3 years of related work experience.
Experience in presenting business process solutions in an easy to understand manner for the client in both verbal and written form
Detail oriented with excellent analytical, communication and organizational skills
Ability to manage multiple projects and responsibilities at the same time
Ability to balance competing priorities and responsibilities while maintaining a professional demeanor
Self-starter with initiative to identify problem areas and recommend solutions
Expertise with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Desired Qualifications

Experience in DoS financial management is highly desired, but not required.
Lean Six Sigma certification
PMP certification

Education

BA/BS

Clearance
All applicants for this position must be able to obtain a certification of a Moderate Risk Public Trust issued by DoS; please note that the clearance process takes into account both criminal and financial background aspects.

MIL is a dynamic workforce of industry professionals who deliver world-class solutions in cyber, engineering, financial management, and information technology – and we are looking for candidates like you. Here at The MIL Corporation, we pride ourselves on the family-like environment instilled amongst our team. Our employees love working here, and it truly shows through our various recognitions & awards. Some of our most recent awards include:

2020, 2019, 2018, & 2017 Top Workplaces Award, The Washington Post (Washington, D.C.)
2020, 2017 Top Workplace Award, Greenville Business Magazine, Columbia Business Monthly, and Charleston Business Magazine (South Carolina)
2019 & 2018 Certified Great Workplace, Great Place to Work®
2018 Fortune, Great Place to Work: Best Place to Work for Diversity
2018, Above & Beyond Award, Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve (ESGR), Department of Defense

If your goal is to help the federal government deploy leading technologies, improve financial management, or defend the nation in cyberspace, The MIL Corporation welcomes you. Become a part of something greater, where you, the people, make the difference.

The New Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the development and implementation of strategic initiatives. The Strategy Analyst is expected to focus and develop customer insights in order to pave the way for strategic opportunities to thrive in the TFS/LFS/Private Label environment.
Reporting to the New Business Manager, the person in this role will support the One Toyota Benefits department's objective to provide world-class customer and dealer experience that helps drive private label growth.

Bachelor’s degree (or higher), or equivalent professional work experience.Ability to build relationships with a broad audience both internal and external to TFS.Manage projects successfully to meet deadlines, provide deliverables, and adhere to budgets.Work collaboratively with other team members.Strong organizational and stakeholder management skills.Strong verbal, written, and analytical skills.Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.).
Added Bonus If You Have
Experience with Agile Software Development Methodologies.Experience with recreational products lending (marine, ATV, RV, etc.) a plus.

GigaMonster Networks is seeking an entry level Jr. Data Analyst to join our growing team!
The Jr. Data Analysts will work cooperatively with our Marketing, Business Development, and Finance Teams to accomplish department goals and other subject matter by gathering, validating, documenting various data, and conducting analytics tasks.
The Jr. Data Analyst will perform various functions, including data collection and analysis to identify useful trends and provide management with relevant information that will facilitate informed decisions.
The ideal candidate must leverage quantitative and qualitative information to analyze and identify opportunities to improve. This role requires high-level communications skills, a strong sense of urgency, and focus on how their analyses will impact the respective business units.
Responsibilities
Collect, analyze, and evaluate data collected from various sources, identify new data sources or ways to look at the data.
Building reports and dashboards for Marketing & Sales Executives. Recommend and strategize new data points and structure for better reporting and analysis.
Collaborate actively with marketing, product, and operations to drive growth and optimization as it pertains to subscribers and revenue.
Analyze historic marketing data to identify trends for future campaigns and marketing strategies.
Proactively monitor all data sources, ensuring all data is synchronized and readily available.
Assist in preparing materials for board meetings, all-hands presentations, and other ad hoc reporting.
Conduct full lifecycle of analytics projects, including pulling, manipulating, and exporting data from project requirements documentation to design and execution.
Create KPI dashboards and reports to provide analytics and transparency across the organization.
Be a collaborative team member who readily shares knowledge and accepts & provides feedback.
Build trusted relationships through proactive account management and effective project delivery.
Foster an environment of continuous improvement that adapts quickly to changes and focuses on agile development principles.
