Who is ONEHOPE?

ONEHOPE is a Napa Valley Winery built on hope and rooted in purpose. We exist to Nourish the Future. Through our technology we enable a purpose-driven community of 5,000+ "Cause Entrepreneurs" to join us on our mission to share wine and give hope through wine tasting experiences nation-wide (most are virtual currently). The Cause Entrepreneur opportunity is at the perfect intersection of "gig economy" and "work from home" and is well suited for the current unique environment we live in. As a Cause Entrepreneur, we give anyone the necessary tools to build a cause-centric business on their own terms.

To date we've donated over Seven Million Dollars and through wine sponsorships and thousands of events held we've helped non profit organizations raise tens of millions more for other meaningful causes. Our award-winning wines are produced by rockstar winemaker Mari Coyle in collaboration with other great winemakers including Rob Mondavi Jr.. Our Estate vineyard and winery is in the heart of Napa Valley. Since launching in 2007, ONEHOPE has grown from a public storage unit to one of the top 250 wineries of 10,000+ in the US. We aim to be the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the nation by 2022.

ONEHOPE is backed by some of the best investors and business builders in the world, including our co-chairman Joe Lonsdale (co-founder of Palantir and 8VC), co-chairman Erik Anderson (CEO of Top Golf and West River Group), board member Jennifer Justice (The Justice Department), Sr. Advisor Richelle Parham (CMO of eBay), Wes Chan (Google Analytics and Voice founder and Felicis Ventures) and Ken Howery (co-founder of PayPal and the Founder's Fund).

Your Team - Growth Marketing

The growth marketing team is pivotal in taking ONEHOPE to the next level. We are focused on building an experience for our Cause Entrepreneurs and customers that will enable us to become the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the world, while simultaneously increasing our ability to empower people to make the world a better place. We're not just another wine company, we're disrupting existing commerce models with modern experiences.

The Role

The Growth Marketing team at ONEHOPE seeks to establish and maintain the data assets, operations, and culture to support a more optimized and introspective ONEHOPE. The team is looking for an impactful Data Analyst to play a foundational role in executing this goal.

As the first hire of the Analytics team, you will become a specialist on data related to all ONEHOPE functions, including Finance, Sales, Marketing, Product, and Community. You will expand our team's impact by leading projects with internal partners from end to end, from problem scoping to the development and maintenance of solutions. You will gain mastery across our analytics stack and take pride in maintaining and improving our data infrastructure to support the team's goals. Lastly, you will be a thought partner to the EVP of Growth on various issues, from designing analyses to setting team strategy.


What You'll Do

Responsibilities will include:

Supporting analytics pipeline - including data modeling to dashboard development in Looker - to enable the proliferation of self-service BI across ONEHOPE.
Leading and executing on data-driven projects from problem scoping to implementation across different functions.
Conceiving and creating data assets (datasets, dashboards, statistical models) that will support relevant teams and company strategy.
Collaborating with data engineering to unlock data sources beyond the reach of our analytics stack.
Communicating findings and recommendations to stakeholders with varying levels of statistical expertise.
Leading trainings, events, and other activities that actively promote and help to develop a data-first culture at ONEHOPE.

Potential projects may include:

Becoming embedded in our marketing team to craft and build the data infrastructure that enables the bespoke reporting vital to optimize their operations.
Collaborating with Go-to-Market leaders to refine our metric-backed stories and working across the analytics stack to generate the assets that support those communications.
Creating churn prediction models that will help our Sales, Marketing & Field Development teams to more efficiently allocate and prioritize resources.
Partnering with the Sales team to arm them with the data needed to train, optimize and close deals.
Building data models that will enhance our ability to do more complex cross-functional analysis.

Qualifications:

2+ years of experience in a data analysis role
Problem solver that wants to tackle new challenges and, given context, being self-directed and passionate about owning your work autonomously.
Create visualizations using tools like Looker (preferred), Tableau, Mode, or Periscope/Sisense for Cloud Data Teams
Good understanding of and interest in statistical concepts vital for nuanced analyses.
Experience with executing in a cross-functional and ambiguous startup environment.
Proficient in using SQL to write complex queries that join data across multiple systems
Data analysis programming languages such as Python or R is a plus
Experience with data modeling layers such as DBT is a plus
Solid background of learning new tools, technologies, and frameworks.


Additional Benefits and Perks:

A best in class team and company culture
Computer and technology provided
Medical benefits
Paid vacation and holidays
Award-winning wine
Flexible work hours
Monthly happy hours and birthday celebrations
Location: Remote; Los Angeles a plus


Sound like a fit?

We'd love to talk to you! Please submit the following to apply:

Resume
Cover letter explaining:
Why you are a good fit to be our Data Analyst
Why you want to work at ONEHOPE

Join us in helping people live healthier, happier & longer lives


PlushCare, an Accolade company (NASDQ: ACCD), is a Silicon Valley-based virtual primary care platform that is transforming the healthcare industry by making exceptional healthcare more accessible, convenient, and affordable. Since 2015, we've connected hundreds of thousands of patients throughout the United States with world-class physicians from a phone or laptop.

As we continue to grow and expand our services, we are looking for passionate and empathetic individuals to be part of our journey. Experience in the startup ecosystem is helpful, but a growth mindset and passion for helping people live healthier, happier & longer lives is essential.


The Role

PlushCare is seeking a Data Analyst to help scale and optimize our telehealth business with analytic insights. This is a high impact role with an opportunity to collaborate closely with senior business leaders across product, operations and marketing and with peers on the analytics team to deliver strategic analyses, help mature quality reporting, and identify improvement opportunities with a goal to deliver a "Wow" experience for patients at scale.

In addition to exceptional analytical and quantitative skills, this role requires a high level of business acumen, excellent communication skills and a knack for project management. As with all PlushCare roles, one must be able to multi-task and thrive in an energizing fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities

Use data to drive actionable insights and recommendations to support growth, efficiency, and an amazing patient experience
Design compelling reporting and data visualizations in Tableau that empower business leaders to make strategic and operational decisions
Use quantitative methods to identify and size key business levers and opportunities; craft clear and persuasive data stories to advocate for recommendations
Help design and analyze experiments measuring feature and campaign effectiveness
Collaborate closely with the data team, product management and engineering on tracking and data quality

Qualifications:

2+ years of professional experience in data analytics
Excellent quantitative and data analytics skills
Proficient in SQL (Redshift, MySQL)
1+ year of experience working with Tableau
Knowledge of statistical reasoning and hypothesis testing; familiarity with Python or R
Strong communications skills; the ability to advise and influence cross-functionally
Bachelor's degree preferably in a quantitative discipline; advanced degree a plus
Experience in healthcare analytics, product analytics, or subscription analytics preferred
Experience with analytics tools such as Heap, Mixpanel, and Google Analytics a plus

We offer:

 An opportunity to elevate your career
 Competitive compensation + equity in a high-growth company
 Professional development budget to support your growth
 Generous vacation policy and take care of your health days
 Medical, dental, vision
✅ 401(k) Match
Quarterly home office and weekly lunch stipends
Plus: A PlushCare membership for you and your family!

THE ORGANIZATION

The Charter School Growth Fund (CSGF) is a leading nonprofit venture philanthropy fund dedicated to identifying the nation's best public charter schools, investing in their expansion, and helping to increase their impact. Our "portfolio" includes 140+ charter school networks that operate 1,100+ schools and serve more than 500,000 students. We are committed to expanding the impact of schools that are closing achievement and opportunity gaps. CSGF operates with the same strategies, discipline, and focus as a venture capital firm by awarding multi-year grants and loans to talented education entrepreneurs building networks of high-quality charter schools that enroll traditionally underserved students. Ultimately, we think the portfolio can grow to serve ~1,000,000 students within a decade.

This is an exciting time to join the Charter School Growth Fund. We are launching our next philanthropic fund in 2022, building on our 15-year track record of success. CSGF's new five-year "Fund IV" will be larger in size and scope than previous funds, with a goal to continue to fuel charter sector growth, accelerate innovation, and strengthen long-term outcomes for students, particularly students of color and those from low-income backgrounds. Our new fund will continue to prioritize investments in leaders of color as our current portfolio is led by more than 50% leaders of color and more than 50% female leaders. We believe it is vital for the networks we support to be proximate to the lived experiences of the students and communities they serve.

THE OPPORTUNITY

About Our Team

With the launch of the next philanthropic fund, the Analytics team is expanding and evolving to meet the growing needs of an ever increasingly data driven organization. The Analytics team sits at the intersection of our investment, impact, innovation, policy, finance, and talent teams which all have data needs to drive their goals. The Analytics team also serves the need to progress monitor CSGF's key performance indicators that measure our impact across the network. These insights are shared internally as well as with our many funders. In addition, we seek to expand the role of analytics to provide direct analysis support to our growing portfolio of charter school networks. To accomplish this, we leverage nationally collected data sets from a variety of sources and provide flexible and timely analysis to our many stakeholders and partners.

The team is made up of three core functions: engineering, data products, and insights research. The full-time permanent role will develop data products, particularly dashboards, for technical and non-technical audiences. This role reports to the Director of Data Products.

Our Analytics Stack

Google Cloud (backbone architecture)
Airflow (data ingestion and orchestration)
BigQuery (data warehouse)
dbt Cloud (data modeling/monitoring)
Tableau (data visualization)

About This Role

As a Data Analyst you will deliver on customer-centered data and analytical products that enhance efficiency, support data-driven decision-making, and enable our organization to scale. Specifically, you will support the growth and maintenance of our current dashboard portfolio in Tableau. In addition, you will have direct involvement in the reporting and analysis of key performance indicators, including student outcomes and school performance metrics.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Below is a general outline of responsibilities. CSGF is a fast-moving organization, roles and responsibilities may change to meet the needs of the organization and the charter networks we support.

It is not expected that every candidate will meet all of the desired qualifications; above all else, we are seeking candidates with an eagerness and ability to learn new skills and solve interesting problems in an environment that encourages creative thinking, quick feedback loops, and opportunities for professional development.

Data Visualization

Build and maintain interactive Tableau dashboards and infographics that enable actionable insights, tailoring visualizations to meet the needs of users while adhering to brand standards
Execute a variety of techniques in Tableau, including forming relationships between multiple data sources, creating field calculations and dashboard actions, and designing more advanced charts (e.g., hex-tile maps, lollipop charts, donut charts, etc.
Synthesize qualitative data, communicating key themes and messages through visualizations
Develop dashboard mock-ups to help elicit and define requirements of data requests
Actively searches for opportunities to experiment with different design approaches and formats, contributing to the team's ongoing efforts to innovate and improve its product line

Data Collection & Validation

Participate in smaller-scale collection cycles throughout the year, including designing surveys, compiling survey results, and reporting outcomes
Perform quality audits of collected data and providing assistance to resolve issues
Support the development and execution of data workflows that ingest, validate, test and model data for analytics needs

Data Modeling and Reporting

Partner with the Analytics Engineer to develop a metrics layer in SQL to centralize organizational key performance measures
Support the Analytics Engineer in transforming datasets for end products, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions
Query from the data warehouse in SQL, calculating and aggregating data when necessary, to respond to data requests.
Support due diligence on high-performing charter school operators by conducting analysis and developing products to display achievement and enrollment data

You're a good fit if you are:

A design-savvy analyst or data-savvy designer with high interest in designing data visualizations and telling impactful stories
Excited about leveraging the wealth of education data we currently collect to influence decision making and increase our impact
Interest or passion in education and commitment to CSGF's mission

You care about questions like:

What is the most essential information to present and visualize in a dashboard?
How can I strategically implement visual design elements (e.g., color, contrast, alignment, white space etc.)?
What would it take for us to always collect valid and clean data for analysis?
How can I ensure that my SQL query returns the correct output to answer the question that Team ABC asked?
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Expected Skills and Characteristics

Exceptional quantitative skills with demonstrated ability to create data visualizations
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of spreadsheets (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets), including lookup functions and pivot tables.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills and storytelling ability
Strong attention to detail and focus on accuracy over urgency
Capacity to quickly learn new skills, seek honest feedback from peers and mentors, and know when to ask for help

Nice to Haves But Not Necessary

Experience with data visualization tools (ex: Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc)
Experience with visual design tools (ex: Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, etc.)
Experience with SQL, specifically in BigQuery

Professional Experience

At least one year of full-time professional experience in data analytics, education, and/or similar fields
WORKING AT CSGF

We are focused on hiring and developing great people and believe that building diverse perspectives across our team makes us more effective in expanding our impact. (This is reflected in Our Commitment to Diversity Statement.) Our core values are:

We work relentlessly to create efficient, measurable, and sustainable results. We strive for excellence and pursue our mission tenaciously. Ideally, you thrive working in a self-directed manner in a fluid environment where flexibility and tenacity are required.
We embrace calculated risks and new approaches. We have an entrepreneurial spirit that welcomes innovation, diversity of ideas, and risk. We rely on you to question conventional wisdom and think independently.
We are truthful, fair, and trustworthy in all aspects of our work. We hold ourselves and our partners to the highest ethical standards. We trust you will too.
We appreciate the challenges faced by education entrepreneurs and recognize the limits of our own knowledge. We understand that our ultimate success depends on that of our partners. Your humility will be key to building trusted and authentic relationships.
We value each of our team members as individuals but believe that we achieve the best results by working together. We willingly sacrifice individual interests and recognition for greater collective impact. We hope having fun at work is important to you and that you are a team player.
COMPENSATION

Compensation is commensurate with experience and education. The target salary range for this role is $65,000 - $85,000 annually. CSGF offers a very competitive compensation package.

START DATE

CSGF is seeking candidates who can start as soon as possible.

Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.
The Product Analyst for Modeling and Simulation Products will be part of the Scientific data consumption product team. In this role, they will work with technical teams, SMEs and stakeholders to uncover and communicate user needs and assist in conducting product discovery activities for modeling and simulation. The Product Analyst will also be instrumental in planning, designing, and conducting testing activities, and compiling critical content for training and communication for our users.
The Product Analyst needs a deep knowledge of users, process and workflows and is critical in the prioritization of changes to the modeling and simulation products. The Product Analyst will also assist with analysis of data to provide information to assist the team in decision making. The Product Analyst will provide deep knowledge of the problem being solved and is a technical translator for the development team.
The Scientific Data Consumption Product Line (SDC) provides a combination of technology, infrastructure, software, and personnel to support large scale scientific data consumption and computing comprising of the Scientific Data Platform, Modeling and Machine Learning Platforms, High Performance Computing (HPC) workflows, and “experience” products such as visualization, modeling workbenches, and analytics development environments.
Primary Responsibilities:
Gathers and manages opportunity statements, use cases, insights, and requirements*, from users, stakeholders, and engineers.
Works closely with the Product Manager, Engineering, UX and Support to create business cases.
Develops and maintains relevant technical knowledge and/or specific domain expertise pertinent to the product area or capability they are working in.
Describes what to solve by writing problem statements and requirements* and facilitates the “how” with the engineering team.
May occupy the position of Product Owner on an Agile team, or work closely with one.
Assists in developing the business case for new products, improvements to existing products, and business ventures.
Planning, designing and conducting testing activities, and compiling critical content for training and communication for our users.
Process data, observations, information and other research into insights that will help inform product strategy and decisions
Education Minimum:
B.Sc. in scientific domain or computer sciences
Prerequisites:
Minimum 2-5 years working with customers to define requirements, preferably in the sciences/pharmaceutical industry
Experience with defining requirements/user stories for pharmaceutical modeling and simulation tools/products
Demonstrate analytical problem-solving skills
Identify and define the business problems
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Effectively engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders and users
Facilitate workshops
Prepare and deliver presentations and/or trainings
Preferred:
Domain knowledge or familiarity with Machine Learning Platforms (e.g. Sagemaker and DataBricks)
Pharmaceutical modeling and simulation in chemistry, pharmacometrics (pk/pd), and data sciences
Pharmaceutical drug discovery and pre-clinical development experience
JIRA, Kanban and Confluence
Experience working in Agile software development
User-centered design
Familiarity with Cloud based software and terms
Knowledge of the Product Life Cycle for software products
Product Analyst Key Deliverables
Business cases
Problem statements/requirements
Product comparisons/assessments and artifacts for use by a development team
Analysis and evidence to document and communicate the data used to make product decisions
Matrices and test plans developed in a risk-based manner
User Acceptance Test (UAT) scripts reflecting the critical components that require testing for each release
Training materials, to ensure user success with the product
Product Analyst: Key behaviors
Show a high level of agency/growth mindset and initiative
Be an effective listener, and be able to understand and simplify complex problems
Exhibit critical thinking to effectively balance the needs of customers and stakeholders
Practice evidence-based decision-making
Work in a sustainable manner and encourage this behavior in others
Ability to work collaboratively across matrixed teams
Have curiosity to understand and empathize with user problems

Who we are …
We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.
What we look for …
Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

Description
University of Pittsburgh Physicians is hiring a Clinical Data Analyst to support the Department of Surgery.
In this position you would be collecting approved research requests, identifying the data necessary to answer those requests, and writing queries and using various visualization techniques to provide clear and concise answers to those requests.
You would work a Monday to Friday daylight schedule from 8:00am to 4:30pm. This position is located at Forbes Tower in Oakland/Pittsburgh with remote work possibilities after orientation period. Experience with SQL and/or Qlik preferred.
UPP Department of Surgery is a surgical department consisting of Vascular, Hepatobiliary, General/Trauma, Transplant, Surgical Oncology, and Pediatric General Surgeons. Its geographical reach encompasses Western Pennsylvania and surrounding areas, performing both clinical and research activities.
Purpose:
The Clinical Data Analyst designs, analyzes and presents analytical solutions to multidisciplinary teams including but not limited to physicians, administrators, and organizational leaders, summarizing population characteristics and outcomes to support data-based decision making throughout the organization to improve elements such as patient care, clinical outcomes, and operational throughput. Reporting specifications to be provided by requesting audience, and subsequently discussed within interdepartmental team meetings. Various clinical and administrative systems will be used as data sources, including but not limited to Epic, Cerner and Medipac. Final aggregation and presentation will be completed through various software packages, including SQL Developer, Qlik and Cognos. The Clinical Data Analyst must ensure reporting logic is accurate and sound by comparing analytical output to data within the source systems, as well as through cross validation to base reports under the direction of the Expert Clinical Data Analyst. The Clinical Data Analyst must be able to work both independently as well as in a team setting.

Responsibilities:
Perform clinical analyses in a team-oriented atmosphere and review the analytical outcomes to both clinical and non-clinical audiences
Interact with various clinical and non-clinical teams throughout each project to ensure data definitions and assumptions are accurate
Identify trends in outcomes, utilization, medical quality, and other areas.
Meet deadlines and turnaround times set by department (these deadlines and turnaround times will, at times, require the employee to work until the project is completed, meaning extended daily work hours, extended work weeks, or both).
Effectively prioritize and complete all assigned tasks.
Develop and maintain working relationships with internal UPMC departments, and external contacts as appropriate.
Stay abreast of new solutions relevant to the department through various webinars and intermittent conferences requiring brief travel
Master new computer software programs and upgrades, as applicable.
Maintain high level of accuracy and timeliness.
Assist in organizing and leading discussions with multi-disciplinary teams, including but not limited to: senior management, department/division chiefs, chairs, physicians, etc.
Identify current /future data challenges, develop meaningful recommendations, and provide timely updates on issues encountered.
Exhibit advanced problem solving using various information sources.
Maintains patient confidentiality and ensures data accuracy.

Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Healthcare Management, or related field
OR High School Diploma and 5 years of relevant work experience.
MS Office proficiency required
SQL/Business Intelligence knowledge preferred
Healthcare experience preferred
Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills required
Must work well independently and within a team
Epic (UPMC's Electronic Medical Record) training is mandatory within the first year of employment, requiring one week of travel to Madison, Wisconsin (only for facilities where applicable)

Licensure, Certifications, and Clearances:
Act 34

Job Description

Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.
The Product Analyst for Modeling and Simulation Products will be part of the Scientific data consumption product team. In this role, they will work with technical teams, SMEs and stakeholders to uncover and communicate user needs and assist in conducting product discovery activities for modeling and simulation. The Product Analyst will also be instrumental in planning, designing, and conducting testing activities, and compiling critical content for training and communication for our users.
The Product Analyst needs a deep knowledge of users, process and workflows and is critical in the prioritization of changes to the modeling and simulation products. The Product Analyst will also assist with analysis of data to provide information to assist the team in decision making. The Product Analyst will provide deep knowledge of the problem being solved and is a technical translator for the development team.
The Scientific Data Consumption Product Line (SDC) provides a combination of technology, infrastructure, software, and personnel to support large scale scientific data consumption and computing comprising of the Scientific Data Platform, Modeling and Machine Learning Platforms, High Performance Computing (HPC) workflows, and “experience” products such as visualization, modeling workbenches, and analytics development environments.
Primary Responsibilities:
Gathers and manages opportunity statements, use cases, insights, and requirements*, from users, stakeholders, and engineers.
Works closely with the Product Manager, Engineering, UX and Support to create business cases.
Develops and maintains relevant technical knowledge and/or specific domain expertise pertinent to the product area or capability they are working in.
Describes what to solve by writing problem statements and requirements* and facilitates the “how” with the engineering team.
May occupy the position of Product Owner on an Agile team, or work closely with one.
Assists in developing the business case for new products, improvements to existing products, and business ventures.
Planning, designing and conducting testing activities, and compiling critical content for training and communication for our users.
Process data, observations, information and other research into insights that will help inform product strategy and decisions
Education Minimum:
B.Sc. in scientific domain or computer sciences
Prerequisites:
Minimum 2-5 years working with customers to define requirements, preferably in the sciences/pharmaceutical industry
Experience with defining requirements/user stories for pharmaceutical modeling and simulation tools/products
Demonstrate analytical problem-solving skills
Identify and define the business problems
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Effectively engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders and users
Facilitate workshops
Prepare and deliver presentations and/or trainings
Preferred:
Domain knowledge or familiarity with Machine Learning Platforms (e.g. Sagemaker and DataBricks)
Pharmaceutical modeling and simulation in chemistry, pharmacometrics (pk/pd), and data sciences
Pharmaceutical drug discovery and pre-clinical development experience
JIRA, Kanban and Confluence
Experience working in Agile software development
User-centered design
Familiarity with Cloud based software and terms
Knowledge of the Product Life Cycle for software products
Product Analyst Key Deliverables
Business cases
Problem statements/requirements
Product comparisons/assessments and artifacts for use by a development team
Analysis and evidence to document and communicate the data used to make product decisions
Matrices and test plans developed in a risk-based manner
User Acceptance Test (UAT) scripts reflecting the critical components that require testing for each release
Training materials, to ensure user success with the product
Product Analyst: Key behaviors
Show a high level of agency/growth mindset and initiative
Be an effective listener, and be able to understand and simplify complex problems
Exhibit critical thinking to effectively balance the needs of customers and stakeholders
Practice evidence-based decision-making
Work in a sustainable manner and encourage this behavior in others
Ability to work collaboratively across matrixed teams
Have curiosity to understand and empathize with user problems
Our Support Functions deliver services and make recommendations about ways to enhance our workplace and the culture of our organization. Our Support Functions include HR, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Procurement, Administration, Facilities and Security.
Who we are …
We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.
What we look for …
Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

Description
University of Pittsburgh Physicians is hiring a Clinical Data Analyst to support the Department of Surgery.
In this position you would be collecting approved research requests, identifying the data necessary to answer those requests, and writing queries and using various visualization techniques to provide clear and concise answers to those requests.
You would work a Monday to Friday daylight schedule from 8:00am to 4:30pm. This position is located at Forbes Tower in Oakland/Pittsburgh with remote work possibilities after orientation period. Experience with SQL and/or Qlik preferred.
UPP Department of Surgery is a surgical department consisting of Vascular, Hepatobiliary, General/Trauma, Transplant, Surgical Oncology, and Pediatric General Surgeons. Its geographical reach encompasses Western Pennsylvania and surrounding areas, performing both clinical and research activities.
Purpose:
The Clinical Data Analyst designs, analyzes and presents analytical solutions to multidisciplinary teams including but not limited to physicians, administrators, and organizational leaders, summarizing population characteristics and outcomes to support data-based decision making throughout the organization to improve elements such as patient care, clinical outcomes, and operational throughput. Reporting specifications to be provided by requesting audience, and subsequently discussed within interdepartmental team meetings. Various clinical and administrative systems will be used as data sources, including but not limited to Epic, Cerner and Medipac. Final aggregation and presentation will be completed through various software packages, including SQL Developer, Qlik and Cognos. The Clinical Data Analyst must ensure reporting logic is accurate and sound by comparing analytical output to data within the source systems, as well as through cross validation to base reports under the direction of the Expert Clinical Data Analyst. The Clinical Data Analyst must be able to work both independently as well as in a team setting.

Responsibilities:
Perform clinical analyses in a team-oriented atmosphere and review the analytical outcomes to both clinical and non-clinical audiences
Interact with various clinical and non-clinical teams throughout each project to ensure data definitions and assumptions are accurate
Identify trends in outcomes, utilization, medical quality, and other areas.
Meet deadlines and turnaround times set by department (these deadlines and turnaround times will, at times, require the employee to work until the project is completed, meaning extended daily work hours, extended work weeks, or both).
Effectively prioritize and complete all assigned tasks.
Develop and maintain working relationships with internal UPMC departments, and external contacts as appropriate.
Stay abreast of new solutions relevant to the department through various webinars and intermittent conferences requiring brief travel
Master new computer software programs and upgrades, as applicable.
Maintain high level of accuracy and timeliness.
Assist in organizing and leading discussions with multi-disciplinary teams, including but not limited to: senior management, department/division chiefs, chairs, physicians, etc.
Identify current /future data challenges, develop meaningful recommendations, and provide timely updates on issues encountered.
Exhibit advanced problem solving using various information sources.
Maintains patient confidentiality and ensures data accuracy.

Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Healthcare Management, or related field
OR High School Diploma and 5 years of relevant work experience.
MS Office proficiency required
SQL/Business Intelligence knowledge preferred
Healthcare experience preferred
Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills required
Must work well independently and within a team
Epic (UPMC's Electronic Medical Record) training is mandatory within the first year of employment, requiring one week of travel to Madison, Wisconsin (only for facilities where applicable)

Licensure, Certifications, and Clearances:
Act 34

JOB SUMMARY
The Credit Services Risk Management team is a large and complex critical function for company success. We are staffed with highly-skilled and motivated individuals with a large emphasis on analytical abilities & problem solving skills. The Data Analyst will provide critical analysis to enhance credit risk functions such as underwriting and/or collections. This person will be the central point of contact to drive business decisions by leveraging deep analytics.


MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide recommendations for new or enhanced strategies to reduce losses and to retain customers
Partner with others to build predictive models and/or to implement solutions in production processes
Ensures that programming tasks are completed before the deadline and are fully tested with minimal defects
Gather business requirements. This individual will need to work with leadership and business partners to identify data and reporting needs for analysis
Develop/select methodologies to derive answers to business problems
Analyze data to provide meaningful insights. This individual must have strong data manipulation and interpretation skills, and be able to quantitatively assess business problems
Identify data sources and data attributes across and outside the company that will support the business needs
Conduct analyses that drive meaningful change on key objectives established by senior Charter leadership
Synthesize actionable insights by joining together large data sets from across the company, and applying appropriate analytical techniques
Communicate findings clearly and concisely through narrative-driven presentations and effective data visualizations to Charter executives and decision makers
Develop analytic plans and testable hypotheses for key business questions raised by partners to ensure that all important questions are addressed fully, appropriately, and accurately
Perform other duties as may be requested by manager

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Strong expertise in SQL
Business and quantitative analysis experience using packages such as SAS/Python/R
Detail oriented, self-motivated, proactive and results driven
Ability to communicate orally and in writing in a clear and straightforward manner
Ability to plan, prioritize and organize effectively
Ability to adapt to change
Highly energetic; ability to partner across business lines; a go-getter who seeks out information and does not wait for others to reach out

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in scripting languages such as Java/Ruby/Perl.
Experience in using large databases; conducting complex analysis languages as noted above
Solving business problems through deep analytics
Ability to see patterns in the data where others are unable to;
Desire to use large databases and complex analysis to solve problems
Ability to explain complex analysis results in an easy-to-understand language
Advance skills in Excel, PowerPoint and Access
Excellent quantitative analysis skills
Ability to create conceptual frameworks enabling the analysis of varied business problems

Education
B.S. in quantitative sciences, including statistics, computer science, engineering, Business with focus on analytics. M.S. in a similar discipline preferred.

Related Work Experience
3+ years experience solving business problems through deep analytics
Industry experience in Financial services, insurance or actuarial services or medical research preferred but not required

WORKING CONDITIONS
Office Environment

At Shipt, we are transforming the grocery shopping experience and giving time back to consumers. Shipt shoppers handpick fresh groceries and household essentials, then deliver them to your door in as little as one hour.
We are looking to hire a Data Science Analyst to join our newly formed Marketing and Ad-Tech Data Science team. You will work in conjunction with our Software Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Product groups to build and leverage insights and reporting to provide insights on both our paid and organic channels. We’re building cutting-edge personalization, optimization, and recommendation solutions that will change how our customers interact with Shipt and help them to understand how we can provide superb grocery delivery service.
This role sits within our Marketing Data Science Analytics team. This team will be responsible for helping our marketing counterparts and working to define data-driven marketing strategies.
This role will provide a high-level of visibility across the organization. Your contribution to the organization will be multifaceted – we are looking for someone who has a strong technical and data foundation and can influence business decisions using that expertise and toolkit.
What You’ll Do:
Be responsible for analyzing marketing channels including campaign optimization, audience creation, budget management, and testing ideation and execution
Lead internal and external communication on performance and analysis of campaigns
Build executive-facing reports on the health of the funnel, marketing effectiveness, etc.
Root cause analysis of performance changes and mix shift analyses
Strategize and coordinate with design, project management, and engineering to design experiments and execute on them
Research ad improvements and new marketing opportunities
Analyze, report on, and give recommendations for driving account growth on both top and bottom line KPIs. Communicate to team and business leaders on a regular basis.
Provide analytical consultative services in areas such as opportunity sizing, data capture/usage, and testing orchestration
Build and launch custom data components for brand-specific needs – this may come in the form of visualizations or notebooks
Increase product stickiness through hands-on analysis, stakeholder training, and case study development to ensure value occurs and is recognized
What are we looking for:
Natural curiosity and passionate drive to solve complex problems
2+ years of experience with a proven track record of success in meeting performance goals in digital marketing
Experience in analyzing performance-focused paid media campaigns on multiple channels such as Paid Search/SEM (Google Ads, Microsoft Ads), Paid Social (Facebook, Twitter), Display, Video, Native, etc.
Proficient in SQL leveraging queries across complex relational database and visualizations tools such as Tableau, Looker or Amplitude
Proficient at collecting and mining data from disparate data sources, and willing to dig deeper and understand the process that creates the data
Proficient with Google Analytics, Segment.io or another segmentation platform; can segment data and analyze performance based on meaningful differences between user groups
Experience working with event data from both web and app properties
Demonstrated ability to drive business decisions and behavioral changes through analytical capabilities
Demonstrated ability to synthesize data into actionable insights and communicate recommendations to leadership
Knowledge of statistical modeling and optimization beneficial, with experience working directly or indirectly on a specific business-application in this field

Insite360 is committed to delivering its cloud-based solutions through a Software as a Service (SaaS) model that provides retailers remote access, visibility, and control of their Tank Gauges, Fuel Dispensers, and Point of Sale. We are automating all aspects of the fuel management process to increase efficiency, lower costs and prevent loss in the fueling and retail operations. We strive to improve uptime and customer experience.

We thrive on passion and innovation and are looking for great people, with great ideas, who want to create the next big thing. We want individuals to push limits, look outside the box and think the unthinkable.
Vontier is a $3B global industrial technology company focused on smarter transportation and mobility. Our five operating companies—Gilbarco Veeder-Root, Global Traffic Technologies, Teletrac Navman, Matco Tools, and Hennessy Industries—are united by a powerful purpose: mobilizing the future to create a better world. Our portfolio of trusted brands includes market-leading expertise in mobility technologies, retail and commercial fueling, fleet management, telematics, vehicle diagnostics and repair, and smart cities. Vontier’s pioneering solutions advance safety, security, efficiency, and environmental compliance worldwide.

Energized by our shared purpose and values, we have a strong culture shaped by a deep organization-wide commitment to inclusion, diversity, equity (ID&E), and corporate responsibility. Eight vibrant global employee resource groups serve as powerful focal points for connection, community, and advocacy, and we actively support community causes through Vontier Cares. We offer flexible remote and in-person, open-space work options.

 Support strategic projects and initiatives for the Business Digitization team. Responsible for building strong relationships with key stakeholders and serves as a key digital representative to the health plans.

related to their areas of responsibility. Communicate issues and roadblocks related to respective area.

job_description:
Overview:

We are not just offering a job but a meaningful career! Come join our passionate team!
As a Fortune 50 company, we hire the best employees to serve our customers, making us a leader in the insurance and financial services industry. State Farm embraces diversity and inclusion to ensure a workforce that is engaged, builds on the strengths and talents of all associates, and creates a Good Neighbor culture.
We offer competitive benefits and pay with the potential for an annual financial award based on both individual and enterprise performance. Our employees have an opportunity to participate in volunteer events within the community and engage in a learning culture. We offer programs to assist with tuition reimbursement, professional designations, employee development, wellness initiatives, and more!
Visit our Careers page for more information on our benefits, locations and the process of joining the State Farm team!
What’s In It for You
Work with cutting edge technologies and business models
Contribute to brand new, patent-worthy, concepts and products.
Be part of small, self-empowered teams.

Opportunity to identify, research, and feed the development of new and experimental products.

Competitive Benefits, Pay, and Bonus Potential.

Local volunteer opportunities.
401k plan

HUB LOCATIONS: Dunwoody, GA; Richardson, TX; Tempe, AZ; or Bloomington, IL
**Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization either now or in the future (e.g. H-1B visa) for this opportunity**
Responsibilities:

The Enterprise Technology Claims Business Intelligence Team provides tactical and strategic data via dashboards, huddle boards, and reports enabling claims leadership to make data driven decisions, manage their business effectively, and provide coaching via performance dialogues and to adhere to legal and regulatory compliance matters.
This opportunity is for a Data Analyst in our Business Intelligence space. The data analyst will be responsible for providing business intelligence via on demand reports and dashboards to a variety of business partners ranging from Claims Leadership to Legal.
This real time, on-demand reporting function enables us to respond quickly to our customers’ needs and to the internal needs of the organization. Examples of reporting include but not limited to: Catastrophe, Department of Insurance, Human Resources and targeted claims data requests. The Data Analyst will be responsible for the creation of dashboards providing data analysis, trending and data visualization.
Qualifications:

We are looking for Candidates with:
Intermediate to Advanced in SQL
Intermediate to Advanced experience with SAS
Knowledge of AWS Cloud Platform and associated tools
Database Knowledge
Data Visualization Skills
Server Management Experience
Able to problem solve and work independently
Able to work in a high paced environment
Able to navigate and manage an assigned workload from end to end
Incumbency Period:
This position will have an 18-month incumbency period, beginning on the effective date of the position, which must be met before the employee can post for any other lateral State Farm position. Employees may be considered for leadership or Technology Engineer openings at any time, and a promotional position within the same job structure (i.e. Professional/Technical or Para-professional/Support) after 6 months from the effective date of the position. In these cases, the remaining incumbency would be waived. The incumbency period does not affect the at will relationship between State Farm and the employee and does not create an employment contract, nor contractual rights.

What we're building and why we're building it.

Fetch is a build-first technology company creating a rewards program to power the world. Over the last 5 years we've grown from 0 to 7M active users and taken over the rewards game in the US with our free app. The foundation has been laid. In the next 5 years we will become a global platform that completely transforms how people connect with brands.

It all comes down to two core beliefs. First, that people deserve to be rewarded when they create value. If a third party directly benefits from an action you take or data you provide, you should be rewarded for it. And not just the "you get to use our product!" cop-out. We're talkin' real, explicit value. Fetch points, perhaps.

Second, we also believe brands need a better and more direct connection with what matters most to them: their customers. - Brands need to understand what people are doing, and have a direct line to be able to do something about it. Not just advertise, but ACT. Sounds nice right?

That's why we're building the world's rewards platform. A closed-loop, standardized rewards layer across all consumer behavior that will lead to happier shoppers and stronger brands.

Fetch Rewards is an equal employment opportunity employer.

The Role!

The Data Science & Analytics team embodies these values and works with a laser focused objective to enable data driven decision making for both internal stakeholders and external partners. We are looking for a Data Analyst to contribute to this vision and reap the rewards of joining an exciting company in the high growth phase.

You will create analytical solutions that help Fetch teams leverage and monetize actionable insights from our unique data. This is a challenging and high visibility position, responsible for creating these solutions as well as influencing technical direction. Success in this role requires the ability to take on challenging problems and design & develop an amazing solution with little to no assistance.

You possess:

Ability to create SQL/Python programming modules for custom insights required by our Product Teams. Leverage statistical analysis to understand what is "acceptable" versus "outliers".
Ability to present insights to business stakeholders through Tableau (primary) / Powerpoint / Excel in a compelling manner.
Ability to successfully collaborate with both business users and engineers for effective analytical solution development and deployment. Create automated KPI dashboards and monitoring reports.
Passion to drive actionable insights from product usage and other relevant data to measure success of experiments, diagnosis of issues, understanding of general consumer behavior.
Knack for conducting the apt Data Exploration needed to enhance the cleanliness and effectiveness of our data sources.
Discipline to create well documented coding and analytics packets to ensure reusability as the team expands.

 Bonus points for:

Expertise in Tableau dashboarding, active within Tableau Community
Experience in analytics at app-based / Consumer Tech companies
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks like Snowflake, Spark and AWS services
Effective communication, ability to translate and explain technical issues to non-technical team members
Love of Dogs! . . . Or just tolerance. We're a very canine-friendly workplace

At Fetch Rewards, we'll give you the tools to feel healthy, happy and secure.

Stock Options

PPO and HDHP plans | Dental | Vision | Life Insurance
Pet Insurance
Education Reimbursement
Unlimited PTO

Flexible 9 weeks of Parental Leave
Full time wellness coach to help meet your exercise & wellness needs
WFH Setup. Whatever hardware and software you need to get the job done
Regularly scheduled virtual events, happy hours, cooking classes, etc.

Hello! Are you interested in a unique opportunity to join an LA based team and help build the next generation of eCommerce tools with a human twist used by some of the most well known organizations in the world?

Humankind is the first Conversational Commerce platform that enables brands/retailers/services to launch 1:1 human-led personalized shopping experiences via SMS profitably and at scale. Imagine giving customers their own dedicated personal shopper to help them always find and buy the exact right products, all through the ease of text. eCommerce has become undifferentiated and formulaic. Our platform enables brands to offer this new and delightful way to shop at scale, driving up to 20x higher conversions,180%+ higher AOVs, and consistent 5 star ratings and reviews

We are a team of collaborators that are passionate about providing the very best that we can to our customers. We are travelers, artists, athletes, animal lovers, optimists and adventurers creating an incredibly strong, fully remote team and providing amazing service, no matter where we are. We're problem solvers, and continuous learners never afraid of a challenge, and we're looking to add an analyst to our amazing product team.

What You'll Do:
As Humankind strives to make our platform the best in the market, your insights and passion for data will help drive improvements by being the voice of the data through running A/B, ad-hoc analysis and deep-dive studies

You will have the opportunity to drive how Humankind ingests and reports insights, both internally and client-facing. You will lead the charge pushing us to be a data-driven organization, and be responsible for communicating best practices, opportunities for expansion and growth, and evangelizing how HK thinks about itself. Story telling - independently uncover insights and effectively communicate your findings and recommendations.

Experience with agile software development.
Knowledge of demand forecasting and automated supply & demand planning helpful
Bachelor's degree in a relevant Business or Product specialization, Computer Science, or equivalent.

CoderPad's mission is to improve the technical interviewing experience with tools that allow for standardization and consistency, in the name of reducing bias and increasing equality of opportunity.
What does a Data Analyst at CoderPad do?
As an early hire on the Data team at CoderPad, you’ll be highly impactful in empowering stakeholders across the company with insights and recommendations to drive CoderPad’s revenue growth! You’ll spend your time combing and analyzing our data, presenting insights to internal stakeholders, building dashboards, and iterating on our data as a product.
You are ideal for the role if you are insatiably curious and love digging into data to answer key business questions! We’re looking for someone highly analytical, data-driven, and scrappy – who is not only comfortable translating ambiguous requests into technical requirements, but who can also communicate a story with data.
Reporting to the Senior Analytics Manager, you’ll have the opportunity to work autonomously and partner with other Analytics team members at CoderPad and our growing global business. If you meet most of the experience below, are excited about the opportunity and willing to learn, we encourage you to apply!
Key Sample Projects
Using SQL to query and analyze data to present to stakeholders and support decision making
Building new reporting tables in our data warehouse for use by stakeholders; occasionally automating reports as dashboards
Partnering with Sales and Marketing to better understand and provide visibility into Net Revenue Retention numbers
Analyzing our customer acquisition funnel to understand if experiments are leading to valuable revenue opportunities for the company
Successful Experience
4-5 years of experience in a quantitative analysis role, preferably supporting a product or marketing function (at a SaaS/B2B technology company is a plus)
Advanced proficiency in SQL and comfortable working within a data warehouse environment (interest in a scripting language like Python or R is a plus)
Experience with web-based BI tools, e.g. Looker, Sisense, Mode, etc.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to synthesize, communicate and present insights from data to non-technical stakeholders
Experience with prioritizing tasks and setting expectations with stakeholders
Passionate about being an impactful, individual contributor
You are analytical and scrappy with a bias towards action
Qualified candidates must reside in the United States and be able to work as full-time employees in the U.S. without current or future visa sponsorship.

Company Overview
CoderPad is on a mission to fix the technical interview process. We serve over 3,300 customers and have hosted more than 4 million technical interviews in 30+ programming languages since our launch in 2013.

Through simplicity, speed and accuracy, CoderPad has become a leading interview platform for hiring teams that need a reliable solution to identify better technical candidates – more fairly! It works like an IDE to emulate real-world scenarios and is easily personalized to specific team needs, ensuring a positive experience for the candidate and interviewer alike. That’s why top companies around the world, like Netflix, Slack and Snowflake, rely on CoderPad to help them prioritize quality talent and scale their hiring efforts.
Benefits for You
We are a small, geographically distributed team. We value the contribution of every team member – personally and professionally. If you enjoy working with a diverse group that feels like a family, we are interested in hearing from you.

Description
The City of Norfolk is seeking a Data Analyst to join an exciting opportunity with the new Department of Housing and Community Development.

The Data Analyst will gather data, build reports, and perform analytics to effectively address housing and community development needs throughout the city. The Data Analyst will develop an understanding of the city’s existing housing stock and associated needs, as well as provide analysis and recommendations for the potential use of city-owned vacant land. The Data Analyst will clearly communicate analysis results and their potential impact on residents and neighborhoods. The incumbent will be responsible for keeping up with emerging technologies especially those with applications to local government.

The Department of Housing and Community Development oversees a variety of housing and community development programs and services for those who wish to be a part of the City of Norfolk's vibrant communities. The department seeks to provide opportunities for City of Norfolk residents to live in safe, quality, affordable housing by developing, preserving, and revitalizing communities through responsible and transparent processes. Join us as we work to build great neighborhoods.

Work Hours: 8:30 am to 5:00 pm
Essential Functions
Essential functions include but are not limited to:
Conducts a variety of research and other assigned projects by compiling and reviewing internal and external organizational information, preparing position and issue papers; and recommending changes for management consideration; analyzes problem areas in service delivery and formulates recommendations for improvements; serves as a staff resource.
Consults with senior departmental managers and provides advice and counsel on management issues, organizational structure, feasibility, and the potential impact of varying courses of action; coordinates interdepartmental program elements with Citywide goals.
Promotes communication by preparing a variety of materials to disseminate program and policy information on a departmental or Citywide basis on senior or executive management's behalf.
Assists management by constructing sensitive documents and correspondence, producing special research reports, serving as liaison on internal and external issues, participating in task forces and special issue meetings and coordinating various projects
Performs related duties by touring neighborhood areas, monitoring events for community access to city hall, conducting research projects and long-term plans, reviewing expectations for accuracy, validity and variances, designing work plans and studying similar organizations for new ideas.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Education/Experience

Work requires broad knowledge in a general professional or technical field. Knowledge is normally acquired through four years of college resulting in a Bachelor's degree or equivalent.

Four years' experience in data analysis or related field; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
The preferred candidate will possess:
A Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Data Analytics or similar field.
Experience conducting and leading analysis projects
Experience building and administering reports and dashboards in enterprise systems such Power BI or Tableau.
Extensive data modeling experience.
Programming experience in languages such as SQL, R, Python, JavaScript, etc.
Formal training in statistical methods
The ability to communicate effectively with all audiences through both oral and written presentations.

Additional Information & Requirements
Vaccination Requirement: The City of Norfolk values the safety of our employees, our residents, and our visitors. In support of these values, if you are selected for a position, you must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, except when vaccination is not medically advised or violates your sincerely held religious beliefs. If you are selected to join Team Norfolk, you will be required to provide proof of vaccination or be granted a medical or religious exemption.

Valid Driver's License may be required.

At Shipt, we are transforming the grocery shopping experience and giving time back to consumers. Shipt shoppers handpick fresh groceries and household essentials, then deliver them to your door in as little as one hour.
We are looking to hire a Senior Data Science Analyst to join our newly formed Marketing and Ad-Tech Data Science team. You will work in conjunction with our Software Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Product groups to build and leverage insights and reporting to provide insights on both our paid and organic channels. We’re building cutting-edge personalization, optimization, and recommendation solutions that will change how our customers interact with Shipt and help them to understand how we can provide superb grocery delivery service.
This role sits within our Marketing Data Science Analytics team. This team will be responsible for helping our marketing counterparts and working to define data-driven marketing strategies.
This role will provide a high-level of visibility across the organization. Your contribution to the organization will be multifaceted – we are looking for someone who has a strong technical and data foundation and can influence business decisions using that expertise and toolkit.
What You’ll Do:
Be responsible for analyzing marketing channels including campaign optimization, audience creation, budget management, and testing ideation and execution
Lead internal and external communication on performance and analysis of campaigns
Build executive-facing reports on the health of the funnel, marketing effectiveness, etc.
Root cause analysis of performance changes and mix shift analyses
Strategize and coordinate with design, project management, and engineering to design experiments and execute on them
Research ad improvements and new marketing opportunities
Analyze, report on, and give recommendations for driving account growth on both top and bottom line KPIs. Communicate to team and business leaders on a regular basis.
Provide analytical consultative services in areas such as opportunity sizing, data capture/usage, and testing orchestration
Build and launch custom data components for brand-specific needs – this may come in the form of visualizations or notebooks
Increase product stickiness through hands-on analysis, stakeholder training, and case study development to ensure value occurs and is recognized
What are we looking for:
Natural curiosity and passionate drive to solve complex problems
3-5 years of experience with a proven track record of success in meeting performance goals in digital marketing
Experience in analyzing performance-focused paid media campaigns on multiple channels such as Paid Search/SEM (Google Ads, Microsoft Ads), Paid Social (Facebook, Twitter), Display, Video, Native, etc.
Proficient in SQL leveraging queries across complex relational database and visualizations tools such as Tableau, Looker or Amplitude
Proficient at collecting and mining data from disparate data sources, and willing to dig deeper and understand the process that creates the data
Proficient with Google Analytics, Segment.io or another segmentation platform; can segment data and analyze performance based on meaningful differences between user groups
Experience working with event data from both web and app properties
Demonstrated ability to drive business decisions and behavioral changes through analytical capabilities
Demonstrated ability to synthesize data into actionable insights and communicate recommendations to leadership
Knowledge of statistical modeling and optimization beneficial, with experience working directly or indirectly on a specific business-application in this field
This role can be 100% remote.
Colorado-based roles: The minimum annual salary for this position is $85,100. You may also be entitled to receive bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits.

As a Customer Data Analyst on Lumere’s Advisory Services team you will partner closely with a cross-functional team of Lumere’s medical device experts, analysts, and account managers to enable our clients to successfully lead clinically-informed sourcing and utilization initiatives.

A successful candidate will be a creative problem-solver who is comfortable charting a path forward with imperfect information. They will share a passion for learning and understanding medical device technology as well as using evidence-based solutions to transform healthcare.

Responsibilities include:

Develop and maintain an in-depth understanding of Lumere’s proprietary data sets
Provide analytical decision support for multiple concurrent client initiatives focused on using evidence-based strategies to significantly reduce cost and unwarranted variation in physician preference item (PPI) use
Manage and execute quality deliverables within timelines agreed upon with client
Model savings strategies based on proprietary data sets, recommended best practices, and client-specific requirements
Support RFP design, analyze vendor RFP responses, and develop award scenarios
Enable post-implementation tracking and measurement using Lumere’s solutions
Prototype new analyses and approaches to uncover insights related to medical device spend and utilization and/or improve internal efficiencies

Qualifications:

2+ years professional background in mathematics, statistics, engineering, and/or informatics
Experience with healthcare or hospital data preferred (e.g., purchase order history, EHR)
High degree of competence and comfort using MS Excel and SQL
Distinctive problem-solving skills
Excellent attention to detail and strong prioritization skills
Demonstrated track record for accomplishing goals and meeting deadlines
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Comfort with ambiguity and fast-paced environments; excitement to lead change
“One team” mentality - excited to work in a highly collaborative, learning-focused organization

GHX: It's the way you do business in healthcare

Global Healthcare Exchange (GHX) enables better patient care and billions in savings for the healthcare community by maximizing automation, efficiency and accuracy of business processes.

GHX is a healthcare business and data automation company, empowering healthcare organizations to enable better patient care and maximize industry savings using our world class cloud-based supply chain technology exchange platform, solutions, analytics and services. We bring together healthcare providers and manufacturers and distributors in North America and Europe - who rely on smart, secure healthcare-focused technology and comprehensive data to automate their business processes and make more informed decisions.

It is our passion and vision for a more operationally efficient healthcare supply chain, helping organizations reduce - not shift - the cost of doing business, paving the way to delivering patient care more effectively. Together we take more than a billion dollars out of the cost of delivering healthcare every year. GHX is privately owned, operates in the United States, Canada and Europe, and employs more than 800 people worldwide. Our corporate headquarters is in Louisville, Colorado, just outside of Denver, with additional offices in Europe, Atlanta, Georgia, Chicago, Illinois, and Omaha, Nebraska.

We are seeking a Research Data Analyst who will work directly with the Program Manager, and Co-Director of the Success with Therapies Research Consortium (STRC) Data Management Core. The candidate is responsible for implementing best practices for data management, with the ability to write and implement code to conduct the workflow. They will be responsible for designing and maintaining data collection, data cleaning, data workflow, and reporting across multiple platforms, research sites, and studies. This role will contribute to the development and growth of the data management and analysis services.

This Research Data Analyst will routinely interact with a multidisciplinary team from the Data Management Core, the Study Management Core, and the funder of the consortium, study principal investigators, study research coordinators, and vendors. Must have ability to manage multi-project workload, both development and maintenance. Depending on the task and project involved the position requires working as part of a team, and individually to complete the work as necessary. The Research Data Analyst should be comfortable carrying out tasks with limited guidance.

Specific Duties & Responsibilities:
Have primary responsibility for research data management, cleaning, reporting, and analysis.
May serve as resource for research staff and field data coordinators regarding data issues: collection, entry, quality, and transfer.
Develop data collection protocols, including defining in detail data requirements, data sources and proper data collection procedures, (e.g., computer programs, appropriate data fields, databases).
Develop and implement data collection quality assurance procedures to ensure validity and reliability of study results.
Create/build and maintain databases, records, and files. Merge data, create, and recode variables to prepare data for analyses.
Write, test, and implement code (R, SAS, STATA, MATLAB, etc.) used for data management, cleaning, and analysis.
Generate reports, charts, tables, and create presentations. Maintain ongoing reporting efforts and construct new and ad-hoc analyses.
Present study metrics as well as statistical analyses at meetings with internal and external leadership and research teams.
Contribute to improvement and standardization of team procedures around data collection and management.
All other responsibilities as assigned.

This description is a general statement of required major duties and responsibilities performed on a regular and continuous basis. It does not exclude other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications (Mandatory):
Bachelor's Degree in related discipline and 3 years experience.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Powerpoint).
Knowledge of quantitative data analysis using data programming software such as R, SAS, Stata, or MATLAB to preform data cleaning and data management.
Experience with data visualization.
Excellent organizational, communication and writing skills required.


Applicants who do not meet the posted requirements but are completing their final academic semester/quarter will be considered eligible for employment and may be asked to provide additional information confirming their academic completion date.

Special Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
Prior experience with programming languages such as R, SAS, STATA, or MATLAB.
Understanding of database structure, data collection practices, and data cleaning principles.
Familiarity with a variety of data formats and conversion between formats (csv, json, xml) desirable.

Physical Requirements:
Sitting in a normal seated position for extended periods of time.
Reaching by extending hand(s) or arm(s) in any direction.
Finger dexterity required to manipulate objects with fingers rather than with whole hand(s) or arm(s), for example, using a keyboard.
Communication skills using the spoken word.
Ability to see within normal parameters.
Ability to hear within normal range.

Duties
As a Management and Program Analyst GS 0343 14, your typical work assignments may include:
Developing new methods and techniques to address complex business and procurement problems.
Reviewing, advising on, and conducting complex analyses and evaluations in support of contract management work.
Writing, coordinating, and submitting procurement documents for approval and or disapproval.
Serving as a Contracting Officer Representative (COR), coordinates and/or administers all phases of assigned contracts from inception to completion including program requirements.
Verifying program requirements and providing complex analysis of contracts and subsequent modifications and enhancements.
Monitoring contract costs, schedules and performance; preparing monthly contract summaries; reviewing and approving contractor invoices, and inspecting and accepting contract deliverables on behalf of the government.

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
U. S. Citizenship Required
Males born after 12/31/1959 must be registered for Selective Service
You must successfully pass a background investigation
You must be able to obtain a Public Trust Security Clearance
You must submit to a pre-employment drug test
You may be required to serve a one year probationary period.
You may be required to serve a one year supervisory probationary period.
Shared Certificates Statement: Applying to this announcement certifies that you give permission for DHS to share your application with others in DHS for similar positions.
All DHS-HQ announcements have a 5 business days open period due to the number of applications received.
Qualifications
Specialized Experience:
You qualify for the GS-14 grade level (starting salary $126,233) if you possess one year of specialized experience, equivalent to the GS-13 grade level in the Federal government, performing duties such as: (1) the ability to understand and articulate terms, conditions and specifications of contracts; and to provide independent cost and burn rate analysis; (2) ability to apply regulations, policies, procedures and instructions applicable to federal government contracting when monitoring projects; and ability to interpret and apply contractual performance requirements and characteristics, and technical data to problems encountered in contracts.

Substitution of education in lieu of specialized experience may not be used for this grade level.

CERTIFICATIONS: COR Level II or equivalent certification is preferred but not required upon entry. Selectee will be required to obtain COR Level II certification within 6 months and COR Level III within 18 months.

All qualifications and eligibility requirements must be met by the closing date of the announcement.

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

Well-Qualified: Applicants possessing experience that exceeds the minimum qualifications of the position and demonstrates acceptable proficiency in all of the critical competencies, including all Selective Placement Factors and appropriate Quality Ranking Factors as determined by the job analysis.
Qualified: Applicants possessing experience that meets the minimum qualifications of the position and demonstrate basic proficiency in most of the critical competencies, including all Selective Placement Factors (SPFs) and appropriate Quality Ranking Factors (QRFs) as determined by the job analysis.

This must indicate your dates of service, your rank, and confirm that you will be separated under honorable conditions. View more veterans' information.
